Reviews.Title: “A spa weekend with the whole family”
Reviews.Author: Tomasote
Reviews.Content: We (son of 7 years, daughter of 9 years and my partner) stayed 2 nights during the Easter-Holidays. We enjoyed the comfort suite combined with a connected next door standard room for the children. The hotel obliges you to have an additional in case you want to have 2 children on your room. I do unsterstand this measure for a standard room because these are indeed too small for 2 adults and 2 children. I do not understand this for the suites because there's plenty of room to have to seperated beds for the children. Anyhow, we enjoyed our very spacious rooms with our own private sauna and whirlpool and a seperate toilet and shower. I love carrera marble and the whole bathroom is out of it! There's a seperate elevator next to the suites directly to the pool. I do not like air conditioning. So, I liked the option to put out the airco system and just to open a window for some fresh air. One negative point was the fact that the speaker in the bathroom did not fuction and that some part of the wooden interior of the sauna was brooken. The breakfast is just perfect; high quality ingredients and a lot of choice! Ask for your personal coffee. If you book online you get a 40% discount on the breakfast. The staff is very friendly and professional. Children are very welcome (which is not always the case in 5 star hotels).The hotel is very well located! We did Berlin by car. We parked in the garage at -1 next to the entrance of elevator!

Reviews.Title: “Fully satisfied !”
Reviews.Author: jojimbo
Reviews.Content: I bought my stay on hotels.com and paid a reasonable price for a long weekend at the Esplanade compared to the standard of the hotel and rooms. Quick check-in and check-out. The room was spacious with big widows with a view to the neighborhood, very comfortable beds that kept me sleeping like a prince. I did not test the breakfast because we ate outside every day. The gym and pool was very nice indeed for those who like to stay a bit active. The gym had mostly treadmills, spinning bike and walkers and a few things to work on the body with. The hotel was within walking distance from the national gallery, checkpoint charlie and the Reichstag/Tiergarten. The subway was 5 min walk from there also. All in all I most certainly will stay here again when in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “very very nicd, very very cheap”
Reviews.Author: kar k
Reviews.Content: I think we got a ridiculous nice price , i think we got lucky... great place, but not a 5star room really.. more like a 4star, but 4star is great! great service great staff great;) great bed! great bathtub. but kind of boring dessert.. but great mojito!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Premier_Roch
Reviews.Content: A Great Hotel with large rooms, comfortable bed - was very enjoyable for the weeks stay. The only downside was the internet was very expensive and there was also no tea or coffee making facilities in the room. The buffet breakfast was very nice and excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for weekend in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: mariusmyk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Esplanade for four days for a family birthday. The room was large, clean and offered most of what you expect of this kind of hotel. The beds where very comfortable. There are two things that should be improved though: First, as more and more hotels offer free internet access, the Esplanade's outrageously expensive fee for internet access seems like a rip-off. Second, coffee making facilities in the room would be great. The rooms are very well sound-isolated. Breakfast in the Esplanade met all expectations. It was included in the price of our room (we had a stay 4 nights-package price). A chef prepared freshly made eggs and omelets, and the selection of fruit, yoghurts, bread etc. was satisfying. The hotel's pool and spa was quite nice. The massage and spa treatments are not cheap, but according to the one person in our group that tried them, they are great. The pool is small, but since there where relatively few people using it during our stay, this was no problem. The location of the hotel has both advantages and disadvantages. It is between the Tiergarten, Potsdamer Platz and Kurfürstendamm. All these attractions are within walking distance. For other attraction, bus or taxi is the best option. A disadvantage is that there is no U-bahn-station in close proximity to the hotel, you have to walk 10 minutes or so to get to one. If you are arriving from Tegel, taking a taxi from/to the airport is propably most convienient. The fare is between 15 and 20 euros. The price of our stay was not bad at all, considering the standard of the hotel and size of the room. Since this is a business hotel, room prices are much lower in weekends than at business days.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Freezing Conditions”
Reviews.Author: grumpyoldkiwi
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable hotel in freezing conditions. Great rooms, food and very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Internet rip-off!”
Reviews.Author: Matt M
Reviews.Content: There are many nice hotels in Berlin but because there's so much choice, I'd seriously advise giving this place a miss. I travel regularly all around the world - I know that hotels like to overcharge for using the internet. But that didn't alleviate my complete shock when I checked out of the Esplanade and found out that I'd been charged 170 Euros for using wi-fi in my room for six night's stay! Why so expensive? Because they apply the charge for each device you want to use, rather than allow you to purchase one charge for the room. As nearly everyone has more than one device (laptop, smartphone, etc) these days, it's the stone age for them to operate this policy but their reply was a snippy, "Every hotel does this." Uh, no, they don't. They also tried to charge me 300 euros for a sink I reported to be faulty, blaming me for the fault even though it was clearly pre-existing. This battle I did win but only after an extremely unpleasant exchange. They also charged me the cost of two breakfasts for every day of my stay, even though my partner only stayed for two nights. Also, the hotel's food, including breakfast, wasn't all that great (the room service club sandwich is truly one of the worst I've ever had), the location's not great and the front desk and concierge were haughty. Like I said, there are a lot of great hotels in Berlin. If you're thinking about staying here, just be prepared for them to try and rip you off with the extra charges.

Reviews.Title: “A little pricey - but nice”
Reviews.Author: Thodin
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a business trip in january 2012. Hotel is a little on the pricey side, nice big, clean rooms, good beds - breakfast and food a little expensive, actually quite a bit compared to cafe´s and restaurants in the city, service very good, location hmm, eventhough located in the center of Berlin - there is a bit of a walk if you want to soak up the atmosphere at the shops, restaurants and bars at Kurfürstendam - one of the main centers of Berlin. There are much closer and cheaper options if that is the pupose of the trip. But anyway Berlin is a great city to visit and there is lot of things to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, overpriced food and drink compared to local eateries..”
Reviews.Author: Amanda66611
Reviews.Content: Lovely rooms, nice staff. If you're going to have breakfast book online as it's €12 compared to €18-20 if you don't. We ate out at nearby Cafe Einstein - not much cheaper but much nicer atmosphere. Harry's Bar in the hotel is just a hotel bar, nice for an early or late drink if you're staying there but not worth a special trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: alex-the-travel-man
Reviews.Content: The executive suite (we got the buisness corner suite) was clean, very bright and comfortable. The heating system annoyed us howewer as we could not control the temperature ourselves. The in-room air condition didnt seem to have much effect, this resulting in us opening the windows at times to let some chill breezes come in to the room. I mean, come on Esplanade, who likes to sleep in 27-28 degrees heat all night in January? At least not us norwegians for sure.. There should also have been a full body mirror in the entré to the suite. 6 euro for a bottle of water, I don´t even want to comment on that. Go to a local store and buy your water for 0, 60 euros. Nice bathroom with shower and bathtub, good selection of amenities. Toothbrushes are free of charge, first time I have seen that in a hotel. The breakfast buffet was very nice, look out for special offers on it as the standard rate of 22 euros is a tad bit to much for what you get I think. The swimming pool/gym/spa area was quite nice. Harrys new york bar – a safe bet if you are in need of a late night cocktail. I have read some comments here about rude staff in the bar. We were treated nicely. Only downside was that they didnt have live music on a saturday night. The employees were polite and nice, but not "all smiles". This is afterall germany. Ordnung muss sein. Very efficient front desk. They did however charge/reserve some kind of deposit (ca 100 euros) on my stay, without letting me know. This has now been replaced. A simple notice would have been fine. The location is ok, there is nothing much in the immidiate surrounding area but it is not far to the main attractions in Berlin. Taxis are by the way ridicioulosly inexpensive in Berlin. There is also an bus stop 2 min from the hotel. The tube station (Nollendorfplatz) is a 8-10min walk from the hotel. For choices in the area try restaurants “Maharadsja” (Indian) and “Il Valentino” (Italian). Both have gotten favourable reviews on tripadvisor. “Bar am Lützowplatz” looked like a good choice for drinks. We paid 139 euro a night for an executive suite (about 55-60m2). That is indeed good value for money, off course not only judging by the size but foremost by quality. Exellent beds and linens! Housekeeping did their job to our satisfaction. Would probably come again given I would get the same deal, but Berlin has indeed many magnificent hotels to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “an excellent 4 star”
Reviews.Author: jockhaggis
Reviews.Content: We had a nice weekend break with friends in Berlin.A very nice hotel but doesn't quite make the 5 stars for me.Some staff a bit surly and don't reach a 5 star service.Good food but a tad pricey for what you get.Rooms comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel, no character and ludicrously overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: Sara C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here mid December for my boyfriend's 30th birthday and let's just say, our trip was a little bit of a let down. Overall, the hotel is spotless, comfortable and very much lives up to its 5* rating in this respect. The rooms were cleaned every day to a high standard, the staff were helpful and the pool was really lovely, albeit slightly cold. However, it was ludicrously expensive!! I've never stayed in a 5* hotel before so maybe I'm just naive in that department but I was under the illusion that paying a lot of money for a hotel room basically brought with it a few luxuries other than comfort?? We arrived at the hotel after a long trip and were greeted with a very pleasant receptionist. We were then showed to our room by the concierge and we settled in our lovely room for the night. My partner opened the mini bar as we were very hungry, only to find a bottle of water was 6 euro and a packet of nuts was 4 euro. Again, may be this is the norm. But seriously, they shouldn't be allowed to sell things at those prices. We ventured down to the restuarant, glanced at the menu and then left again...there was no way we were paying 20 euro for a burger. The hotel wouldn't be that bad if there was a shop or off licence near by but there is NOTHING. We ended up walking for about 20 minutes to get something to eat or drink and ended up getting on the subway to find something. Not a great welcome to Berlin. Admittedly, if we were that hungry we could have paid those prices but I really think that 'luxury' hotels play on the fact that wealthy businessmen stay there who can claim on expenses and unfortunately, the hotel definitely fits this bill. It is extremely 'businessy' and lacks a lot of charm and character. The hotel is huge so we very rarely saw other guests, except for a businessman spending nearly 150 euros on three beers and food in the restaurant one night. On the last night we decided to splurge and order sparkling wine on room service. I had bought this in advance during the booking stage so they bought it to our room, we opened it and it had corked. When I called them to replace it, they took an hour to bring a new one up. We'd gone to bed by this point. The breakfast was stupidly expensive (there's no way I would ever pay 5 euros for a croissant...) so we never ordered any. Harry's bar is very pretentious and the rude barman kept our change from a 20 euro note when our bill only came to 12. The people that go in there are snotty and stuck up so we steered clear. There was also an event taking place on one of the nights that looked akin to a film premier...lets just say that when we returned to the hotel from our day's sightseeing, we were looked up and down by photographers and glared at by the guests. I definitely won't be staying here again but if you're a businessman looking for comfort, this is right up your street!!!

Reviews.Title: “not quite 5 star”
Reviews.Author: maddyHampshire
Reviews.Content: i stayed here with my spouse for three nights over the new year period. we enjoyed our stay and i would definately stay here again. however, although the hotel is rated 5 star, and there are many good points, there are also one or two areas of improvement needed. GOOD POINTS 1. staff were always helpful and polite 2. everywhere was spotlessly clean 3. our room was very comfortable, clean, and well appointed 4. breakfast was delicious with a wide choice of hot and cold items 5. decoration of whole hotel was of an excellent standard, the style is modern 6. the bedding is very high quality and therefore very comfortable 7. the hotel is well situated, it is possible to walk to many sights in the city 8. the hotel is on the banks of the canal giving it a quiet, but reasonably central situation POINTS FOR IMPROVEMENT 1. charge of over 6 euros for small bottle of water in room - 5 star establishments normally provide complementary water 2. heating in room wasn't operative the whole 3 days we were there, the radiator was cold, and the blown air heating appeared to be faulty, it didn't work. upon telephoning to relay this information, 2 young girls were despatched to our room with a small fan heater. they fiddled with the buttons, felt the radiator and advised us to turn everything off and use the fan heater. although we were not especially cold due to using the fan heater, and also the rest of the hotel was very warm - therefore our room contained some of the heat from the rest of the hotel - we felt that for a 5 star establishment, this was an inadequate response 3. chocolates are placed beside the bed each evening, but on our last night they did not materialise. again, for a 5 star establishment, this is unacceptable 4. no DVD player in room, again not good enough for 5 star 5. no computer access available, since tourists do not usually carry their laptops with them, it is impossible to check in for your flight on line, therefore obliging you to stand in a long line at the airport, and possibly, like us, not therefore being able to sit together on the aircraft 6. for those who do take a laptop, usually business people, the internet charges are over 6 euros per hour - perhaps hotel management feel this is acceptable for businesses to pay, however many hotels offer free internet as i stated earlier, i would stay here again, however my husband said he would not stay again, as he felt the hotel makes unnecessary charges on top of an already high rate, which in particular, hit the tourist more than the business person, who usually have all their costs met by their company. the hotel will provide a kettle, cups and milk if asked. we took a few teabags up from breakfast aswell, so we could enjoy a cup of tea when we returned from sight seeing. there is a small grocery store just around the corner where you can buy water and soft drinks for a very small price, if like me, you need to carry water with you at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel exceptionally friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Vivienne-youngFamily
Reviews.Content: I stayed with 3 young children, hotel was spotless and the staff were extremely helpful and welcoming. Pool was nice. Good breakfast. Loved it -thanks so much!

Reviews.Title: “5 star all the way”
Reviews.Author: kellyleman
Reviews.Content: First of all let me say how much I loved this hotel! Really 5 star all the way. The room was wonderfully suited to all of our needs, they even put chocolates on our pillows, how sweet…. king size bed. high level of cleanliness. The staff was very welcoming and helpful. THE BEST BREAKFEST BUFFE that I have ever seen or ate in my life! it is big and fresh and they have everything! Do not miss out, even if it is not on display they will make it or search for it without any fuss at all. Simply Incredible. We loved loved loved the indoor pool and every day would end with some pool time! Transportation is a problem if you like yours public… but I recommend taxi's because they really did not cost much more and you can find a cab in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Harry's Bar a must!”
Reviews.Author: Sky051
Reviews.Content: A weekend trip to Berlin for some Christmas shopping. Very good central hotel. deals can be found online, see if you can find on that includes breakfast! Prefer the river side rooms. We were on the 5th floor. Very clean as you would expect from a 5 star hotel. Decent restaurant, although I suspect you will eat out as many restaurants are a short walk / taxi ride away. Highlight of our trip was Harry's Bar in the Hotel. great cocktails, fab atmosphere, in house entertainment when we were there was provided by Chris Mars, a great vocalist at the piano. Covering tracks from every decade. At midnight the place was packed and was intimate enough to feel that you were at a private party. Very friendly, attentive staff. Overall a great weekend away. Whatever you do go to Check point Charlie, really amazing stories of East and West Germany.

Reviews.Title: “A real alternative to the 5* hotles at Berlin”
Reviews.Author: flyingfox007
Reviews.Content: Location: The hotel is located close to Potsdamer Platz and easily accessible by public transport with a bus stop just 2 minutes from the hotel. Front desk: Efficient and friendly. Room: Spacious, friendly and clean room with modern furnishment. Bathroom clean with bathtub. Breakfast: Good quality, friendly atmoshere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nik G
Reviews.Content: In one sentence: Great hotel, very nice design, great value for money. Having previously stayed in other 5 star hotels in Berlin I was quite dissapointed with the price/value level but I must say this hotel was well above average. The rooms are as good as you can ask for and the design is really refreshing, both in the rooms and the common areas. Negatives: Reception staff seemed a bit rude, but i think that's just the German style. They will help you if you ask, but won't really get out of their way. Seems to be the case in most hotels I have stayed in Berln. The only reason I might stay elsewhere on my return to Berlin is it's location, to be fair, it is only 15min walking distance from the heart of the city but if you're only in Berlin for a couple of days (i usually visit for the ITB / travel exhibition) it can be a bit inconvenient at times. All in all, a very enjoyable stay, 100% recommended !

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to stay. Don't miss Harey's New York Bar”
Reviews.Author: OchoNW
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend trip with friends. Very nice and friendly staff, nice and big rooms. All clean. Excellent gym with all kind of work out facilities incl. Indoor Pool. The only negative point I have is the breakfast area that gave an impression of the waiting area at the train station. And the breakfast itself was just average. In the evening I suggest to have a drink at Harey's New York Bar with a wide choice of coctails and good live music. Hotel is located in walking distamce to Potsdamer Place and Ku' Damm.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and great service”
Reviews.Author: JimS48
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff are exceptional. Prompt and friendly service - in the dining area, bar and housekeeping. Bedrooms are well appointed with down filled duvets. I was attending a conference of 200 people and the hotel was always willing to accommodate changes in room layout, serving meals quickly and making sure the meeting ran smoothly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thekoolone88
Reviews.Content: My Girlfriend and I have recently returned from a 4 night stay in this fantastic hotel, one of the nicest hotels we have stayed in. Everything from booking to check out was without fault. As we didnt have a credit card, we emailed the hotel to enquire about an alternative means of payment to which they replied that a bank transfer would work. Astrid, a hotel employee, was extremely helpful with regards to booking the hotel. Again, when checking in, as we had no credit card, a cash deposit was accepted to cover any room service charges or accidentials. This is definately a big plus! We had booked a executive suite and it didnt disappoint! A large living room area was seperated for the main bedroom area. This was perfect for relaxing in after a long day of sightseeing around a wonderful city. The bed was extremely comfortable and the hotel's evening turndown service was a very nice touch. The bathroom was more than adequate. Terrific shower, large bath and very spacious. Roasting hot water on every occassion. Absolutely no complaints here. We ate in the hotel once. We took advantage of the dry weather and ate outside under a heater. This is a lovely area for just relaxing and people watching. The food was also first class. On our final night we had a few cocktails in Harrys Bar which was a great experience. We also used the Gym which was more than sufficiently kitted out. We didnt get a chance to use the pool but it also looked really nice! The location of the hotel would not exactly be classed as city centre but it is in a beautifl location on the banks of the river. It is a 1/2 mile from the nearest U-bahn station (Nollendorfplatz) which takes you to all the places of interest in a few minutes and is very easy to navigate. Berlin is a lovely City with plenty to do. A hop on, hop off bus tour is usually the best way to see a city. But in Berlin, be careful which company you use. We got tickets for a bus tour for Tempelhofer (http://www.tempelhofer.de/bct.htm) and were told it was in a live english speaking tour. It was quite the opposite. It was lead by an old guy who spoke mostly in German and mumbled a few english sentences on occassions. We perservered for about half the tour but the final straw came when a police escorted cascade of black limos passed us, obviously containing VIP's of the political world (Korean Flags if I'm not mistaking) and the guy never even spoke one word about them...even in German. In my opinion, thats the reason to take a live tour so the guide can speak about things that happen in the spur of the moment. We got of at the next stop and never looked back. This was a blessing in disguise as we then went and done a walking tour. By far the best way to see Berlin. It was throught the 'Original Berlin Walks' company and it was absolutely brilliant! Our guide, David, was brilliant; informative, knowledgeable and very funny. I cant recommend this tour highly enough! I will be doing a review on their tripadvisor page in due course. But overall, getting back to the hotel, we had a great stay in the Grand Hotel Esplanade. The only negative I would say is that the use of the internet is slightly over priced but if its a relaxing holiday you are after then this can be overlooked. So thanks everyone at the Hotel for a great stay.....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Decor”
Reviews.Author: Puck42
Reviews.Content: I wasn''t sure what I had signed up for, but starting from the beautiful waterfall that greated us on arrival, this was one of the best hotel experiences. The service was exceptional, the rooms were clean and large (though not particularly fancy, this is why a 4), the lobby was very good. And did I mention the service?

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: MikeT_Hessle
Reviews.Content: Couple of days here on business, excellent experience. Very professional and friendly (not always an easy balance). One complaint was that water left outside the minibar with a sign in German (which I don't read) I assumed to be complimentary, but was charged for - bit naughty. Must recommend the Eck restaurant in the hotel - genuine German food at an excellent price

Reviews.Title: “Really Great”
Reviews.Author: snitz020
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. Nice rooms, great linens, quiet location yet central to the sights.(right around the corner from the Museum of the German Resistance... Von Stauffenburg)...the bus stop that goes by all the sights is very near. They have bike rentals and we found that an excellent way to get around. I found the room a bit hot, so housekeeping brought in a fan right away. We missed our flight going home, and when I called to see if we could stay an additional night at the same rate, there was no problem. We swam in the pool...small but clean and indoors. I would stay there again for value, comfort, location, service.

Reviews.Title: “Grande indeed”
Reviews.Author: fionasister
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Berlin and we certainly chose the perfect hotel. Our room was spacious and the bed was huge. Everything in the room was of a high standard and the bathroom didn't let us down - an excellent shower. Staff were very welcoming, attentive and helpful. We tried both restaurants and enjoyed a good meal in each. Harry's bar - superb for a great night out. Excellent cocktails, service and live music - absolutely not to be missed.The atmosphere in Harry's is second to none.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: krandy21784
Reviews.Content: Very good location with a great outdoor area to relax after a hard day. Not far from the zoo, museums or other attractions. its located on a waterway and very scenic

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Mark N
Reviews.Content: I had spent the previous week on business in Berlin (from NYC) and this trip completely coincidentally was part of our honeymoon booked way in advance. We stayed in a suite that was clean, spacious and very comfortable. It's location is perfect as it is quietly situated but within easy walking distance of all of the places of interest. I recommend the Grand over the Hotel Concorde that I had stayed in the previous week as the staff were more attentive, the rooms more spacious and the food much better. We don't normally eat in hotels in city centres but we were dragging our heels on the first night from traveling. The food was really good and inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “I will be back”
Reviews.Author: liberal5
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this place twice now. Although I ussually stay at a different hotel when I travel to collect points I have found the rooms here to be modern, updated and the place generally fun. Not always laid back but not typically loud. Harrys Bar is popular although I am not sure why, the food is good solid food but not great, but the beds are really comfortable and I like the Penthiouse Suites. Kind of a large single room affair with balconies. I am going back in October, I really really really love Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice with bright rooms”
Reviews.Author: atrejseeratleve
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 3 nights with colleagues, attending a conference. My room on the 7th floor was spacious, clean and nicely furnished, good bedding, too. Robes and slippers are available; but struggled with the hot water every morning....just wasn't easy to adjust, resulting in luke-warm showers and lackluster water pressure. The rooms on the second floor facing in on the hotel, btw, are a bit funky as they overlook the flat roof and you basically feel like you are on the ground floor; I asked to switch and was happy I did. The breakfast was good; had gluten-free bread and buns, too. The outdoor bar/restaurant area is a bit odd, basically right in the middle of the entrance to the hotel. There is a very nice much more local restaurant two blocks away, Cafe Einstein, that I would highly recommend. Hotel location is ok, but not very close to the main attractions, but Berlin is a pretty compact city, so it's only a short taxi or bus ride to Mitte. The hotel is right on the river, btw. At Euro 99,- a night, it was good value.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Terri B
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here.The room was large clean and modern the bed was comfortable and the staff helpful and friendly.The hotel was not real close to the city but we walked it several times,but there is a bus near by which was great so we didnt find it a problem.It would be good if there was more lights in the reception area as it was dark all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel however consider others as well”
Reviews.Author: M Jawad S
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 4 nights on the recommendation of our business partners. The room and bathroom was spacious and clean. No complimentary water or tea/coffee making arrangement. The breakfast was very good however was billed separately. Although I did not take breakfast on the first day of my stay I was still billed. No free WiFi even in the lobby and charges are very high. Dinned in on my first day and did not like the fish I ordered. All later meals were from Potsdamer Platz.Considered the restaurant right on the entrance and in the passage of the guests a bit odd. The location of the hotel is also not all that good. It is 10-15 min walk to Potsdamer Platz.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: memofromistanbul
Reviews.Content: 1) The room that I booked (nominally a penthouse suite, but a medium range room in the hotel's scheme of things) was around 60 m2 for 139 euros per night. Comparing this to some of the other quality hotels in Berlin, it is a very good deal. 2) There is a balcony, but it has zero privacy as the separators of the balconies are rails and not something like frosted glass, which would have been preferable; so you need to be careful before going out for a leisurely outdoor cup of morning coffee in your underpants. 3) Even though it is a bit far from the city center (it took an hour's walk to get back from the Museum Island), it is a hub of activity, with a good outside restaurant right at the entrance. The hotel appears to do a brisk convention business, so there was always a crowd in the lobby. 4) I was prepared for stiff and efficient German service both in the hotel and the restaurant, but was surprised at the smiles and personal attention, which were not at the expense of efficiency.

Reviews.Title: “High quality hotel at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: GoguBoston
Reviews.Content: Stayed there during Women World Soccer Cup. Excellent room size, clean and well furnished. Soft beds, bath robes and slippers. Very good and variate bufet breakfast . Small indoor pool but clean and elegant. Quite location, a little bit far from downtown, but bus 100 stop is nearby. In the same hotel was the German Nat'l team.

Reviews.Title: “Grandeur hospitality at Esplanade.”
Reviews.Author: Gradiva
Reviews.Content: Grand Hotel Esplanade is a very good place to stay in Berlin. Compared to Grand Hyatt at Potsdamer Platz, the location is a bit further away from the center, meaning Unter den Linden, Museum Island and so on. We had a car, so it was not so much a problem – in fact, I would recommend getting a car in Berlin; the public transportation is somewhat slow albeit abundant. Berlin is a sprawling city, and the distances between attractions are enormous. Let’s say Berlin is definitely not a walking city; perhaps it befits the spirit of Prussian grandeur that everything is given ample space to not feel crumped. The inspiration of the city and its love for enormity is best expressed by hotels like Esplanade and places like Gendarmenmarkt. For a traveler who demands comfort this could be a blessing, since Berlin boasts spacious ultra-modern hotels like Esplanade, which seem to cater to every whim except being boutique and charming. What was a little surprising on that scale was that the pool in Esplanade is not huge, compared to Grand Hyatt; however, it is heated in Esplanade, which is better than in Hyatt where it is beautiful but unusable since ice-cold. At the same time, in Esplanade the pool is in the basement and there is no hot tub, while in Grand Hyatt you have a marvelous hot tub at the top floor, with an open-air solarium and a splendid panorama over Berlin and Philarmonie. The bathroom in our room was also simpler than in Hyatt, while the bed was more comfortable – I think Esplanade probably has the most comfortable bed in Germany! The room is spacious, and there is plenty of closet space; I also liked the colors - pastel yellow, which gave it a warm touch (in Hyatt the steel-grey palette radiates coldness and sharp angles; in Esplanade it is more soft and rounded, which I prefer personally). The best thing was the concierge Johnny who recommended a great restaurant Hartmann's (Fichtestraße 31, 10967 Berlin) - we had a splendid dinner there, with French-style cuisine; I liked it so much that I also wrote an illustrated review of Harmann’s here on TripAdvisor – take a look. I liked everything, it is a very good choice between Hyatt and Concorde - the location is not as good as Hyatt but perhaps better than at Concorde; as I mentioned, compared to Concorde, Esplanade has a pool. The corridors are really long and huge in Esplanade, but this is the case with modern hotels. All in all, Esplanade is a very good place to stay, service is superb. I notice from other reviews that personnel seems rude; I observe that Germans are generally more curt and reserved that Americans, and sometimes appear abrupt. They may also retort an opinion to a hotel guest, which could come across as shocking to an American. It is true they are not as sugary sweet as here it the States, not to what one might get used to in NYC hotels, where staff are so exceedingly nice that sometimes sugar seem to drop from their lips when they speak to a customer. I would attribute German attitude to cultural difference, not to rudeness; it seems as this is just not a tradition there to be so exceedingly obsequious and always smiling; however, in Esplanade I found the staff very helpful and efficient, and we enjoyed our stay there, I would eagerly come back. In general, I found in East Germany hotel staff is much more friendly and caring than in West, in Munich or Koln, for example. It feels in Berlin that they really want your business and welcome you at their German best. It was my third time in Berlin, and I fall in love more and more with this great city of culture, art and music, generous cuisine and attitude, and I wish to be back soon, including marvelous stays in hotels like Esplanade and Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious bedding, cool pool/sauna, great staff, fab bar!”
Reviews.Author: WorriedMomDC
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this hotel-- a nice oasis in Berlin, which still feels like a city in transition. The pressed sheets and feather pillows/duvet were pretty close to heaven. Harry's Bar makes an AMAZING peach sling in a very chic atmosphere! The rose petal sauna was quite an experience, and while the pool is small, it was just right to help us get over our jet lag. Only complaint-- the hotel is not convenient to the underground and while we walked to KaDeWe and other places, it was further than I expected. But would def. stay there again, and the hotel staff is hugely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, pity about the WiFi”
Reviews.Author: Errigalclimber
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel, no question. We found the service friendly and efficient and our toddler loved the kids' check-in desk! The rooms are of a decent size and the double bed was superb. The location is not great for access to the main shopping areas, but the very regular 100 bus to Friedrichstrasse leaves from just outside the hotel and is like a cheap sightseeing bus, it goes past so many of Berlin's main attractions, including the Siegessaule and the Reichstag. The lack of free WiFi was a disappointment, however, and the charge for daily usage we found pretty outrageous, so much so that we did not use it at all. The hotel should reconsider this policy - even the smallest establishments these days are offering free WiFi. Happy to recommend this hotel and it does offer some excellent last minute deals.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulaQ
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Grand Hotel Esplanade 5 nights in July 2011. We were amazed with our room - spacious, with rooftop terrace and a glass wall. We felt like we were living in private apartment, overlooking Berlin. Clean and cosy, nice furniture, big bathroom. Food is quite good, but what is excellent, is their bar - extreme variety of drinks and cocktails. Hotel was really famous in 80ties and early 90ties, may seem a bit oldschool nowadays, but we did like this vintage feeling. I agree that smoking should not be allowed under the canopy roof in the front of the hotel. But a serious mistake is that the hotel does not offer free WiFi (and the price in unacceptable). I do not agree that the staff was unfriendly, reception as well as the consierge worked properly.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit not a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: benny21
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in this hotel a couple of years ago with some friends and we absolutely loved it. This time around I booked it as a surprise for my friend's birthday but was worried in case it did not live up to the expectations I had of it from my previous stay. Thankfully, though, everything was just as perfect as it was the first time around. I have read a few reviews on here that say that some of the staff were unfriendly. I did not experience this at all. Any encounters we had with the staff they were incredibly friendly and polite. The rooms very clean and very tastefully decorated, and the beds were absolutely heavenly! When we stayed a couple of years ago we absolutely loved Harry's New York Bar in the hotel so we made a point of visiting it again this time around. Unfortunately some of the cocktails were now slightly smaller than they had been, but still delicious, and the staff very friendly. The location, while not totally central, is not very far away from anything either. It is only a short walk in one direction to Potsdamer Platz and to the Kurfürstendamm in the other. The only thing I would say negatively, which I have noticed a few other people mention is the charges for use of internet. It is 6.95Euro to use the internet for one hour - there are separate tariffs for 24 Hours and 1 Week. I feel that this certainly is too much and 5* hotel should really be in a position to offer free Wi-Fi. But all in all, absolutely fantastic and I will certainly be going back for a third time in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “not a fan”
Reviews.Author: samwabs
Reviews.Content: This was my last night before heading back to the US. The hotel was nice, but I found the staff a little rude. Also for paying more to stay here I was surprised to have extra fee's such as internet access for $20. You can find better hotels with these things included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but not a great location”
Reviews.Author: squowell
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 4 nights and it was very comfortable with a great bathroom. The hotel had great facilities although the pool being triangular was a bit annoying for swimming! There was a lovely undercover eating area outside which had some delicious food. Unfortunately it's a 10-15 minute walk from Potsdamer Platz and about 20 minutes from Zoolischer Gardens so the location isn't great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but receptionist was unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: MicceFromFinland
Reviews.Content: A good hotel but the smoke in the glass canopy was disappoing. Smoking should not be allowed in the front of the hotel. Hotel should educate the reception staff with more friendly service, even the one-star hotel have better service in reception than in this hotel. Room was very good and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel - very good value”
Reviews.Author: caztaylor
Reviews.Content: The room was large, comfortable and clean. Good breakfast. Only criticism would be the cost of extras - wireless internet, bar costs, etc., and there was no tea/coffee facility in the room

Reviews.Title: “Good, but seriously overpriced and impersonal.”
Reviews.Author: BGroovy25
Reviews.Content: Very busy and fancy looking hotel, with great rooms with stunning views over Berlin. But some major drawbacks; had to pay to use the saunas, they nothing special and some of the saunas were not even turned on, room service was massively overpriced for what it was, housekeeping called at 8.50 banged loudly and woke us up on the first morning of our stay, we were on holidays, trying to rest. Wehen we said this to the receptionist we were rudely told that 8.50 is not early. Well, sorry, yes it is when you are on vacation and have been travelling non-stop all the previous day!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, Spacious, Clean, Comfortable Rooms! Would Definitely Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: MamaHannahStevie
Reviews.Content: We were here for only two nights but I wish it had been longer. I can't believe how inexpensive it was to stay here. We had the Executive Room and it was awesome! We had a living room and the bathroom was huge. The room was immaculate. The breakfast was very good. The location was a little of the beaten path but you just jumped on a bus around the corner and you were able to get to the attractions very quickly. I would not stay anywhere else if we returned to Berlin. I took two teenagers and we loved Berlin and the Grand Hotel Esplanade. The staff was very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Just great”
Reviews.Author: Zizkovfc
Reviews.Content: For a cost of 79 euros/night this hotel is just FANTASTIC! We had a spacious room not facing to the river, but our room was just great. Our room was at the 5th floor so the view was good! The reception staff was helpfull,polite and nice! And the service that someone does carry your luggage to the taxi/room was fantastic. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel, it was expensive, but a few blocks away you find nice places to eat breakfast. Also the bus 100 stops close enough the hotel. U-bahn was about 10 min walk to. But if you have been walking round Berlin all day, the way from u-bahn to the hotel, was heavy. Only negative what I found was that the room was too warm. No air condition, or if they had, it did not work. The cleaning ladies did do exellent job. Thanks! Definitely we will go back to the lovely Berlin and to hotel Esplanade

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: paddie40
Reviews.Content: Lovely clean & spacious room overlooking river. Reception staff very helpful. Harrys Bar nice & food good. Only disappointment was hotel pool was very small, no jacuzzi & you had to pay 9 Euros for an hour for the sauna, which in a 5 star hotel is a bit much. Otherwise quite central but quiet area - lovely comfy beds -would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Grand Hotel Esplanade”
Reviews.Author: Pevsner
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights at this very good hotel. The level of service, quality of the rooms and the excellent buffet breakfast were all first class. The rooms were comfortable and quiet and therefore we slept well every night. Excellent bathroom and the room serviced very well each day. Some aspects of this hotel are expensive - internet is EUR6.95 per hour (we did not use it) and the breakfast if not bought as part of the pacakage could be seen as very expensive at EUR22.00 per person per day. It was included in our very reasonable rate bought on the hotel's website and we made the most of it. Beware a very expensive minibar (par for the course at such hotels) but if you keep it simple and avoid the extras this can be a very reasonably priced top class city centre hotel. Some may find the fact that it is 10 mins to the nearest Metro station a bit of a nuisance and it is quite a way from the main tourist areas but that is probably why the room rates are better. We would definitely stay again on our next trip to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nicole08
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and normally stay in very good hotels or, when travelling for private, in small charming hotels. As I work in the travel industry I'm familiar with the common standards of what's supposed to be a 4 star hotel. This hotel is more than 4, I'd even say it's very close to 5*. Staff is incredibly friendly and professional but still discrete, rooms are generous with all armenities and facilities you'd ask for in any decent 5 star hotel. Buffet breakfast is great in variety and choice, dishes are freshly prepared and orders are quickly taken from staff in a friendly and prompt manner. Lobby is generous and inviting. I can only recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here but drink and surf elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice, big rooms, look new and fresh with windows that open BUT.... 9.50 euros for drinks in the bar/restaurant, and 23 euros for internet Stay here but drink and surf elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “big city style and comfort”
Reviews.Author: laygatelad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights over new year.The 10 minute walk to the centre of town was a bit of a drag in the snow and cold,but otherwise it was an extremely comfortable and welcoming place, making us feel at home.Bar prices were very high but what you expect from a 5 star city centre(ish) hotel .Breakfast was pricey too, but again no more than you would expect and it was very good. We had all breakfasts in the hotel.We did not eat at the restaurant but did try the pub-type place in the hotel when we arrived and that provided a decent snack for us all at a reasonable price.Rooms were big,comfortable and cosy.

Reviews.Title: “About 10 minutes to walk...”
Reviews.Author: powderdog
Reviews.Content: ...before you get to anything interresting. But if you can tolerate that, this is an absolute bargain. With three children, we had two rooms, upgraded on upper floors with great view, for a couple of days for less than the cost of two dinners. Nice and clean pool and good coffee in the bar. Bus stop just outside the hotel, so if you can do Berlin with bus and metro, there's no reason for not staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome rooms, service was not five star.”
Reviews.Author: kpegs
Reviews.Content: This was the last hotel I stayed in while visting Germany. I loved my room and it was very clean. Service was not so good. Staff seemed confused and when asking about locations in the vicinity of hotel we were given a map. Not a simple map. A cartoon like map like you would recieve at a theme park. This was rather annoying. I specifically asked for the address of a restraunt they recommened so we could drive there...they handed me a map again. 10 min walk...they say. Ok. Just ignor the fact of what I asked for and totally disreguard the fact that I'm in heels and dress that I probablly don't want to walk 4 blocks away+ it's cold outside. Sorry guys 5 star hotels are better than this. Get with the program. Open your restruant on Sundays too.

Reviews.Title: “friendly and helpful staff, decent rooms, good location.”
Reviews.Author: sheadster
Reviews.Content: My room wasn't ready on arrival, and despite booking a double I ended up with a twin even after a wait. Depsite this the room was good. The beds were comfortable and the standard room was fairly large with additional seating. The hotel restaurant was good, fairly reasonable cost-wise for a hotel restaurant, in a relaxed and informal atmosphere. Breakfast was OK - standard. Room service was slow to respond and not particularly hot on arrival. Harry's bar cocktails were delicious. Staff were really friendly, helpful and keen to assist. All spoke impeccable English. The rooms were very clean and housekeeping could not have been more helpful. Location is good - across road from Bauhaus Archive and up road from Tiergarten. Transport links excellent - within walking distance of several U-Bahn S-Bahn and bus routes that are easy to navigate your way around. Taxis always available at hotel foyer. We stayed at a very busy time (New Year) and staff were probably stretched, but the atmosphere was relaxed friendly and the staff courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but not five star in my book”
Reviews.Author: Matt M
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at the Grand Hotel in a Penthouse Suite for New Years. When we first arrive we were pretty happy with the room, until we noticed that our room faced the opposite direction of the Tiergarten. When we booked the room through the 1-800 of the hotel in July, the representative took note that we wanted an excellent view for NYE and said our room would have a great view. After looking at the map of the hotel we found out that none of the Penthouse Suites have a view of the north, something that would have been nice to know booking the room, and even nicer for the representative of the hotel to know when we booked! The staff was helpful and found us an alternative room, albeit a smoking room, that did have a better view, and the odor was tolerable, if noticable at all. The location for NYE was excellent, we were able to just walk north to the Tiergarten for all the festivities. The fireworks were amazing from our balcony, which was one of the primary reasons we chose this hotel. However, if it had not been for NYE I would have wanted to book something closer to all of the action, or at least closer to a Sbahn station. We ate at both of the restaurants at the hotel, as well as the breakfast buffet. All were good and moderately priced for a hotel restaurant. Overall we enjoyed our stay at the hotel, barring the initial problem with the room. The service was five star, but the facilities are not quite there in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kirkby84
Reviews.Content: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. It was a bit of a distance from some sights but close to some others. The room was amazing. It was very clean and had everything we needed. We would stay here again if we went back to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “I can't say enough about this place...”
Reviews.Author: pletchHeidelberg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Berlin for New Year this year, our first time to the city. From the second I got to the hotel I knew that I was being taken to a hole new level. I can't say enough, this was the single best hotel stay of my life. The staff was simply second to none, no one else even comes close, then the rooms, clean, roomy, well equiped and lookike like the picture, (pretty rare in my book), the bar well if you can't get your poison there, then it isn't available...anywhere. And the Breakfast buffet, it has been a long long time since I have had something that complete, fresh and nice. THe kitchen staff was a freindly as any I have seen, and the place was spotless! Would I recommend this place...in a second! I can assure all of the readers, I will most definately stay here again, and if this is an example of the rest of the Esplanade hotels, I will be a frequent customer! Jonny, you are a rock star, Thanks for making our holiday perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Seedy "Grand" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BKB_10
Reviews.Content: The location, entrance and guest services initially experienced in the hotel are excellent. The rooms are adequate. But, the hallway trafic in the early to late evening is absolutely unacceptable to a family oriented traveler. Never did I leave the room after 8 p.m. that I did not see a prostitute in the hallway. Usually she was finalizing the location of her "date" via text, but always it meant walking around a business woman concluding a deal for the evening. It was obvious. I complained to the management and they simply said they did not try to "manage" the behavior of their guests and that their lobby bar was one of the most popular party spots in the city and they knew that young women and men came to the bar to find companionship for the evening. They did not seem to mind when I commented that prostitution and other crimes usually went hand in hand.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in central Berlin”
Reviews.Author: j9langley
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 4 nights at this lovely hotel. It is easily accessible to any locale with Berlin's amazing public transportation system. Although we experienced some heating issues with our room, the staff worked diligently to solve the issue. We had a suite which allowed extra space for our young daughter and us to have our own private bedroom. The restaurants were quite good albeit on the pricey side. Do not include breakfast in your plans unless you are big eaters as the bill is 18 euro p.p. There are several cafes within a quick bus ride or 10 minute walk--well worth heading out to start your day and much cheaper! :) The pool was perfect for our young daughter, but honestly only used it twice as the city is so wonderful to explore. Note that this hotel generally caters to business/upscale types--not really 'family' oriented as we enjoy a quiet, upscale hotel instead of family-themed types.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: abqann
Reviews.Content: We were at the Grand Hotel Esplanade for 4 days and nights. Everything about it was just perfect for us. The staff were welcoming, helpful, and very pleasant. The room was large and the breakfast may be the best in a hotel in Berlin. I can say nothing negative about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ifbourg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a convenient place (approximately a 10 minute walk from the sony center and potzdamer platz). My room was clean and spacious. The staff is friendly and helpful.On the other hand, i found expensive the charge for breakfast, parking, Internet access. I think that the responsible of the hotel should change the price for these services.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond espectations!”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn W
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything a hotel should be. The food, service, rooms, and staff were all excellent. This is a green hotel in that the lights in your room are controlled by your key card. Everything is super comfortable and lovely to boot. Most of the main attractions from this hotel are accessible by cab or underground. Walking is not an option. Not only is the hotel excellent in every way (the buffet breakfast is beautiful but pricey), it is beautiful in decor as well.

Reviews.Title: “good 5* hotel style”
Reviews.Author: anna_austrian
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good 5* hotel style. Fine furniture, solid doors and good sleep quality. Very beautiful decorations from the outside: waterfall, excellent outside sitting possibility. Nice New York bar with all possible drinks, fine restaurant. Staff is very good, practically flawless (except that the cleaning woman who has been taking out the key card away from the switch leaving our laptops uncharged). It has a very nice and warm swimming pool. The location is a bit isolated from anything else, but still central. Internet access is hugely overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here in October 2010”
Reviews.Author: MichaelandEmer
Reviews.Content: Location of hotel is good, it's next to the Tiergarten and around 15 mins walk from the Zoo train station. It's served by two buses from here, the 100 and M29 which took 5 mins to get to hotel. It faces onto a canal so no traffic noise day or night, great for a good night's sleep. The main lobby was pretty buzzy, there's a few bars there of which Harry's Cocktail Bar is one of the best. Nice, small and intimate it gets lively as the night progresses. We looked forward to coming in from a day of sightseeing to relaxing in the room and going down for a night cap. Room itself had plenty of space. Bed was ample. Me and my girlfriend like a big bed and had no issue with the one in our room. Loads of space to kick out. Only iffy point was that there were two single duvets on the bed. These would have been fine as invariably I usually wakeup to find the other half has relieved me of my half of the duvet but they were a bit on the small side. You couldn't really wrap up in them. View of Berlin was nice, we were staying on the 6th floor. The pool area was on the cold side, it opened into the spa area upstairs which meant all the heat went up there. It wasn't great for relaxing there because of this. Girlfriend could only spend 10 mins in there while I was in the gym. Also, the pool is triangular and a bit on the small side. More for going for a dip than swimming a few lengths. The gym itself is ok for casual travelling users. More than one serious user and you would have an issue as although there were a few cardio machines, there was only one bench which I felt I was hogging doing my workout. No problem i that I was the only one using the gym each time I went there. We spent a week there and it really added to our overall enjoyment of Berlin. It was very clean, the staff were helpful and polite and I always looked forward to getting back and relaxing there after our sightseeing. I would 100% recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of visiting Berlin. Nearly forgot - wifi was expensive, approx €100 for a week. No idea why hotels don't offer it for free. Needless to say I didn't use it but would have been good to have the option to check emails, news from home etc. Films were also pricey €12.50 for a movie. Still, these are optional so complain if you buy. Gym was

Reviews.Title: “Generally ok, but over priced”
Reviews.Author: comrade98
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights. 180 euros per night including breakfast. The hotel is generally pretty good, but overall impression that for a 5 star hotel it was a bit of a rip off. A nice bottle of water awaits you in your room on arrival - easy to assume it is free, but very small print tells you it is actually 6 euros. No tea or coffee making facilities in the room, but room service add 5 euros to the cost of each order, so no a sensible option ( but there is a good coffee kiosk out the back of the hotel,-large coffee 1.40 euros). 9 euros to use the sauna in the gym. Breakfast is a whopping 18 euros for a pretty standard buffet. Internet access expensive (6 euros an hour??) Gym is good. Pool is an awkward shape but ok. Bar is good, beer prices reasonable. Rooms are ok, very comfy beds. Good location, very handy for the bus. 5 mins walk to U Bahn. Staff generally very helpful, who went out of their way to assist us gettinga taxi on a Saturday night when there were closed roads due to the marathon. Overall, a good enough hotel but over priced and all the additional charges were over the top. Ok to stay here if money is no object.

Reviews.Title: “As good as always”
Reviews.Author: djlandolt
Reviews.Content: Not the first time I've been at this hotel but it is a pleasure every time. Very gentle staff, rooms that are beyond of what you pay for and well placed if you do not mind walking 5 minutes to the next subway station. And if you do, there are enough taxies waiting right in front of the covered entry hall. I can reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very elegant-nice to see a pool in Europe”
Reviews.Author: bonbot062
Reviews.Content: Family of four in Berlin-staff was exceptional. However wished we could have saved some money and been able to put the four of us in one room-put that's minor. The hotel was spotless and centrally located. GREAT breakfast! Great views!

Reviews.Title: “Great week in Berlin.”
Reviews.Author: Khristophoros
Reviews.Content: I visited Berlin for 5 days in August with my girlfriend. This was booked on Expedia& got an excellent deal. It was our 1st time at a 5star hotel& felt that it made the grade. 1st impression of the hotel was that it looked very professional& modern. We were greeted at the front entrance by a member of staff who offered to take our bags& the reception staff were very polite& efficient. Our room was very comfortable, spacious& maintained daily by housekeeping. The hotel isn’t exactly in a central location, however it is a short walk (5mins) to Nollendorfplatz U-Bahn station& is very close the the Teirgarten park which is good to explore. The down side to this hotel is that it felt a bit overpriced. We went to the hotels bar, Harry’s New York Bar, where we ordered a Jack Daniels& coke, and a beer which came to 18euros, the cocktails were on average 12euros. It also cost 6euros for a bottle of water so we found ourselves purchasing drinks from a nearby convenience store instead. The Mini bar in the room was rather expensive also. This aside, I would definitely recommend this hotel& would consider returning to here on a future visit as I found Berlin to be a fascinating city with a lot to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin - Grand Hotel Esplanade”
Reviews.Author: ElissaA
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel across from the Kanal (canal) in heart of the former West Berlin. The staff, including housekeeping, are attentive and professional. Great bar with live music each evening as well as outdoor cafe area for drinks, highlighted by an artfully lit waterfall curtain as a backdrop. Very helpful concierge, front desk staff and lobby staff. The breakfast, included with the room, offers a wide variety of choices with friendly welcoming wait staff. Beds are super comfortable. One of the canal boat rides stops for passenger pick up directly in front of the hotel. Caveat no ATM or Bankomatic, however, one is located approximately two blocks away in the Hotel Berlin, Berlin. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, good location, a little expensive”
Reviews.Author: Magicnumero
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a brief mid-week city break in Berlin. The service offered was very good, staff friendly and knowledgable. The hotel is a little out of the city centre, but transport connections are good and its a simple enough walk to most of the major attractions in Berlin if you prefer to go by foot. The standard of the accommodation was very good. The large sized room was comfortable - the bed exceptionally so. The room, like the whole hotel, was very clean and tidy. The health/liesure amenities were excellent. The pool was a little on the small side, but quiet so it didn't matter too much. On the downside, charging for even the smallest things (drinking water in the room) seems excessive and unnecessary. On balance though the price was reasonable for the high level of service given.

Reviews.Title: “Top quality hotel with spacious rooms and nice river view”
Reviews.Author: silvershot1973
Reviews.Content: 5 star hotel in West-Berlin that offers great value for money. We paid a little extra for guaranteed river view and it was absolutely worth it. The best hotel we've stayed in for years. Highly recommendable! Norwegian Berlin lovers

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: pamelajeans
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel from which to discover the delights of Berlin. The No 100 bus, which is a couple of minutes' walk from the front door, takes you to the Zoological Gardens from where you get the U and S bahns and buses to wherever you want to go. Make use of the excellent value day tickets . After a day's sightseeing enjoy a swim in the hotel pool. Breakfast choice was excellent and the staff very pleasant and efficient. Hope to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Great, as always...”
Reviews.Author: klara47a
Reviews.Content: I know this Hotel from various business-trips. I recently stayed there for the first time with my partner for a private-weekend in Berlin. For me personally, the Esplande is the Hotel to stay in Berlin. Due to business-trips to Berlin I know most of the 5*-Hotels in Berlin. Of course the Esplanade is not suitable to low-budget-travellers, but you can be sure to get the most for your money. The Hotel is located in the heart of Berlin (5 Euro-Taxi-Trip to Brandenburger Tor), great Spa, large rooms, fantastic beds (I know what I am talking about), great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy hotel”
Reviews.Author: -Shedeevil-
Reviews.Content: We were a group of about 16 people who stayed 2 nights at this hotel in june 2010. We were met by friendly staff. We arrived a bit to early, so we had to wait a while to get to our rooms. We spend our time having some lunch at the outdoor area, which is really nice. The food were'nt all that great, I had some pasta. The waitor also had problems to communicate with us, even though we speak good english. the rooms were nice and clean, and the bed confortable and big bathroom. Good A/C. Flat screen TV. Minibar. We spend some time in the indoor pool area, and we also payed to get to the sauna area. Very relaxing and good for the mind and body. The hotel is nearby metro stations, so it is easy to get around. The hotel staff is helpful if you wish to take a taxi. Our last night we had some drinks in the outdoor area, and they were good :-)

Reviews.Title: “Top of the line hotel”
Reviews.Author: kevinhanjoon
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel!!! We (2 adults) got a room for $100 CAD a night ($50 each) for a 5 star hotel! Luckily, we booked it early that's why we got an amazing price. The location is perfect. It is within walking (or a 5 min cab ride) distance to Brandenburg Gate, Reichstag, Sony Center, Tiergarten Park, Berlin Zoo etc. The room was very spacious and our TV offered many channels as well. The beds were incredibly comfortable and it was tempting to just sleep in all day rather than exploring the vibrant city of Berlin. Unfortunately, when checking in to our room my pillow had a stain but it was replaced immediately. The hotel also offers a pool and gym with a separate elevator for guests only. We also ate at one of the restaurants and had a delicious 3 course meal while being serenaded by a jazz singer. I would definitely stay at this posh, modern and classy hotel! tschüss!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous 5 Star Hotel in Quiet Location”
Reviews.Author: surreptiously
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Berlin for one week in March 2009. We had booked the Melia Berlin for the first five nights but they were fully booked for the sixth night (Friday). We booked it for the first five anyway and, with the money we'd saved, we looked for another hotel and stumbled upon the Esplanade. We booked it for our final night and decided on a whim to splash out the tiny bit extra it cost to upgrade our room to the Komfort Suite. We made an excellent decision. The hotel is gorgeous. The staff are great and very professional and they treat you as if you are royalty. Everything is spotlessly clean, well designed, spacious, comfortable, welcoming, relaxing and luxurious. It was definitely the nicest and fanciest hotel that we have ever stayed in - and the little extra we spent upgrading our room was more than worth it. We found ourselves in a massive suite with entrance hallway, living area, bedroom, study with desk, bathroom and en-suite sauna. Everything was perfect. Our suite even had a doorbell. Our entire stay was like a fairytale. The hotel amenities that we used were all great. We ordered room service and it was quick and the food was good. We went for drinks in the famous Harry's New York Bar which was nice and the music was good. The staff are treated us well but some of the other guests in the bar were a bit snobby and looked down on us as if we shouldn't be there presumably because we are young and don't look wealthy - and also because we had arrived early and claimed the best seats in the bar! I would recommend this hotel to anyone. It's gorgeous. The staff are excellent. There was not a single negative thing I can think of. If you have a little extra money and the cost of upgrade is not too much then I would also recommend you upgrade your room and allow yourself some luxury, just to make your holiday that little bit better. I've added quite a lot of photos of the Komfort Suite so have a look for yourself. Location is good. It is a little further away from the city centre so it's quiet and peaceful. We didnt have a problem with being further away having stayed in the Melia Berlin on Friedrichstrasse for the first few nights. The hotel is literally about 2 mins walk from The Bauhaus Archives, it's a five minute walk from the Tiergarten and maybe a 15 minute walk from the Victory Column.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding hotel that is an excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: MyPetNJ01
Reviews.Content: The Esplanade was a great choice for our first visit to Berlin. The facility is outstanding, the location is quiet yet close to transportation (the M29 busline in front of the hotel went to many of the prime tourist destinations) and sites, and the staff could not be nicer and more helpful. The concierge Johannes Bannert handled our every request promptly and made many good suggestions. The nice indoor pool was welcome at the end of a day of touring. The room was spacious, comfortable and spotleess. The clientele appeared to be very international with a good mix of tourists and business people.

Reviews.Title: “Met our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Berlin26062010
Reviews.Content: Grande Esplanade was just as expected. Location was good with the Nollendorf Platz metro station at 5-7 minutes' walking distance (three metrolines run there). The room was very cozy, spacious, clean and quiet. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Downstairs there was the lively Harry's New York bar that was busy with a live performer every night. The gym and pool were free of charge and large enough to have a work out. As you can expect, minibar drinks and the hotel's own restaurants and other services (e.g. spa) are rather pricy - but no need to use them, Lidl and MiniMarket are nearby and Berlin has lots to offer when it comes to eating out and going for drinks. Only real minus was the air con that we would have liked a bit cooler especially at night times as the weather was great with 30 degrees celsius and clear sky. But even that did not bother us too much to ruin our experience.

Reviews.Title: “It is the only Berlin hotel I'll now stay at....”
Reviews.Author: LaciLou
Reviews.Content: Hotel is overall excellent Breakfasts are wonderful; the dining room serves incredibly good food and the soups are fantastic Abilty to sit outside summer or winter (heat lamps) is refreshing; and nice by the river The service however has always been first class Rooms are very large and have everything you need; spa is great. If you are touring Berlin, the "jump on jump off bus stop is 1 min walk outside in a little park

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: PH_KP
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel! We loved the large beautiful rooms, the very nice swimming-pool area, the lobby and the super-breakfast! The hotel is located right in the middle of the West-side (Kurfurstendam, Zoo,...) and the East (Unter den Linden, Reichstag, Museuminsel,etc...). Everything is within walking distance! A few minor details: Second day ... no clean towels in badroom, 3 days with the same soapbar (we did not get a new one), the little shampoo was already used by the guests before us (half empty) and will probably be used by the guest after us. This hotel has a 5-stars ranking in booking and tripadvisor, but personaly I think that to earn the 5th star even those minor details have to be ok! So I would say: problably one of the best 4-star hotels i have ever stayed! Great place! If i ever come back to wonderful Berlin, i will certainly book again in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pamy_Orlando
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hotel Esplanade for three nights at the beginning of May. The room was really nice, clean and spacious. We had a great room overlooking the canal. The staff are really friendly and make you feel welcome. We went to Harry's Bar one night. It was really small and had the feeling of a school reunion about it. Maybe it was just the crowd that was in that night. However it does do nice cocktails! This hotel is a great location if you want to explore Berlin as a whole. However as we spent most of our time in the East of Berlin we would probably get a hotel in the East next time. We walked to and from the hotel to do our sightseeing during the day but at night we took taxi's (girls and their high heels, lol!). It was never more than 10 Euros a trip. A couple of nights we went to the Brandenburg Gate area (Dressler and Lutter and Wegner) and the other night we went to Marjellchen in the West. A really smart hotel! Have a great time if your going! Pam x

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the slippery floor by the pool!”
Reviews.Author: OperaLover_10
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights in the hotel and was quite satisfied with the service, over all facilities and specially with the very friendly staff. But there are two things which you should do something to make them better: both the bathroom and pool area floor are very slippery! Beeing an elderly lady I was scared of loosing my balance, and my younger friends had the same experience. Otherwise, the pool was very nice. There are also some items I would expect to find in the bathroom of an hotel of this class. I was very dissappointed, when there was no bidet in the bathroom, and no handle of any kind to help you to climb out of the bath tub. I hope you do have rooms with these assistive device, so that I can ask for such, when I visit you next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CAB03
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights. No complaints whatsoever. Nice rooms, good conference facalities and great staff. Look forward to coming back

Reviews.Title: “Confortable rooms and very good services, internet should be free...”
Reviews.Author: JLMitry59
Reviews.Content: A high class hotel, with confortable rooms and very good services. An hotel of this category should include free internet access: the rates applied are anormally high.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, spacious rooms but bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: RSVP40
Reviews.Content: Pros: More space than average for European hotel room Friendly and knowledgeable staff Good amenities including parking garage Clean well kept rooms Cons: Noisy Location (busy street) Smoking allowed in front courtyard restaurant Expensive internet

Reviews.Title: “Beware the cost of bottled water temptingly provided in your room!”
Reviews.Author: Dobs12
Reviews.Content: We should have known that a 5 star hotel does not provide free bottled water in the rooms but were caught out by the fact it was left on the side. The price was a whopping 6 euros for a bottle (750ml!) which they include as part of the mini bar service. We were grateful that the small chocolate thoughtfully placed by the bed each night was indeed free! Pool and use of gym was free but 9 euro charge for sauna. Good hotel, staff were friendly, helpful and professional. Wonderful location near the splendid Tiergarten - highly recommended although the room was very stuffy and noisy with the windows open. Thoroughly recommend hiring bikes from the hotel to get around Berlin which is a very cycle friendly city.

Reviews.Title: “Does exactly what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: DBenedict
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights, during a city break in Berlin and it couldn't have been much better. Service was excellent, staff seemed to be willing to help in any way possible. Our shower was broke (presumably during cleaning) but was fixed within five minutes of the reception being informed. Room was a high standard, cleaned regularly with stocked mini-bar and big tv with channels in plenty of languages. There were mainly business folk there during our stay but more holiday makers arrived to give it a more relaxed feel. The price of food is expensive though so you might want to eat elsewhere. I would recommend Harry's Cocktail bar, expensive but exquisite. Nearest U-Bahn is a five minute walk away (Nollendorf) and there are cafes dotted around near the hotel. City centre is approx 15 minute walk if you fancy it. Zoo is 10 minutes walk away. I would say that there are more restaurants and cafes in Mitte (centre of Berlin) but there are some on the Ku'Damn just 15 minutes from the hotel. Taxi from Schonefeld Airport cost 40 euros or you could get the airport express to the zoo then taxi to hotel. If you want a stress free, high class hotel in a quiet area this is it. If you want no frills and have the centre on your doorstep then look a little closer to town. This comes highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and a relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: Slacker59
Reviews.Content: The hotel location at a calm street provided a secluded and very relaxing atmosphere. The room was spacious and comfortable, robe and slippers very nice. Staff was wonderful. There is easy access to the Kurfurstendamm area by bus 200 as well as to Unter den Linden in the opposite direction by bus 100. Both stops near the hotel. Bus M29 just outside the hotel entrance takes you close to Checkpoint Charlie.

Reviews.Title: “Everything just perfect”
Reviews.Author: djlandolt
Reviews.Content: This place is really great. Nice, spacy and very clean rooms, gentle staff and well placed in Berlin. There is nothing I could complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull time”
Reviews.Author: ScottishHighlands
Reviews.Content: We only stayed in Esplanade for 3 nights, but I'm glad thats where we decided to stay. We got a fantastic deal of £99 per night which is well worth it for this hotel. The Hotel itself looks rather bland from a distance but once you are up close it suddenly changes into what you would expect. The staff are very friendly and helpfull, however not the quickest when you are sometimes looking to order drinks, but this is realy the only fault I have, be prepared if you are drinking in Harry's Bar to pay that little bit more. The rooms are large, very clean and well presented. I great little Gym and a clean, warm pool what more could you ask for. You will be a good 20 minutes brisk walk to pubs, shops ect but with taxi's right at the front door (literally!!) you will not be stuck. A beautifull hotel and very resonably priced, I look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Way to stay”
Reviews.Author: Seanandersonusaf
Reviews.Content: Chance brought me to this hotel and it was the best stroke of luck ever. My wife and I had one of the best times of our lives here and the Esplandade had a great deal to do with it... Thank you.
