Reviews.Title: “Great hotel shame about rude and arrogant bar manager!”
Reviews.Author: Gantor51
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband during the ITB event, we were there half on business and leisure. The hotel staff were excellent, very friendly and rooms clean and tidy. Harry's bar has an excellent entertainer who really made the people sing and dance it was a special experience and we enjoyed it very much. It was good to stay there in the night so we didn't have to leave the hotel all the time, but the manager of the bar was very rude and and not friendly at all, he appeared very arrogant and spent most of the evening what appeared to be arranging prostitutes for certain guests. We stayed there before and noticed a few of these ladies were there every night and disappeared into the elevators with different people every night. We will not be staying there any more unfortunately, especially with my husband as i found it very intimidating.

Reviews.Title: “We have found our favorite!”
Reviews.Author: Snorkfroken
Reviews.Content: Berlin is our favorite city, and we go there (from Finland) as often as possible. We like to stay in the west (around Ku'damm/Tiergarten) because over the years we have found "our" restaurants, bars and shops there. And since the U-bahn takes you (almost) anywhere around the city, it really doesn't matter where you stay. We're a middle-aged couple, picking a 4+ star hotel. We usually check the offering and prices from several sources, and book a hotel which fits our needs to a reasonable price. From now on I won't compare prices anymore - we've found our favorite hotel in our favorite city! Our new favorite is Grand Hotel Esplanade. The location of the hotel is not optimal if you don't want to walk at all, but the Berlin taxis offer short rides to a special price. A 10-15 minute slow walk to the nearest U-bahn station is not bad, if the hotel is such a jewel as this one. Very kind staff; nice, clean and spacious rooms; an excellent breakfast; bikes; pool (quite small, but though nice) and gym; ... I really warmly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Smart and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JaneBoleyn
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal from a well-known website for this hotel and had Junior Suites. They are really plush and comfortable with huge windows and balconies that look over the city. Unfortunately the balconies either side of you can see right in so you have to shut the curtains for privacy. The deal did not include breakfast which would have been 19 Euros extra which we thought extortionate, so we ate in a Berlin cafe on the Ku'damm - a much better experience. The hotel is a typical huge 5* business hotel right by the canal (they have their own private yacht). Taxis wait in the entrance road and smartly dressed lackeys open the doors. Harry's Bar is apparently the Bar of Berlin to be seen in - we did have a drink there and the pianist was very good but it was full of people on expense accounts not Berlin locals. We were a bit miffed that there were no tea/coffee making facilites in the rooms - this meant you could only get a drink with room service or in the bar at great expense. Bit mean, we thought. The hotel is a way from the main city centre but the hop on/off bus service City Circle has a stop only 100m away. Taxis are plentiful and not a bad price.

Reviews.Title: “In this hotel you are not a guest, you're just another client”
Reviews.Author: vagelisAthens_greece
Reviews.Content: Obviously low-cost oriented service. No tea/coffee machine in the junior and executive suites, where we stayed. No complimentary fruits or mineral water or wine, extensively offered in 5 stars hotels. Very low quality toiletries. Very small lobby.We payed 7 euros to print our boarding passes!When we needed to move to another room in midnight (because of allergy that occurred to a member of the family, probably due to the room's furnishing) the concierge denied to help us because it was late, and punished us to move our 80 kilos luggage ourselves! Although we understand it was late, ''service'' means exactly to assist your guests in a difficult moment and not let them down in such an impolite way! Overall dissappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “A very good service all round”
Reviews.Author: chipos
Reviews.Content: I would have appreciated being given information detailing the fee upfront (150 Euro to be paid) as well as the non-avaialability of meals prior to my arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, good price, nice location”
Reviews.Author: elbalsamo
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay! everyhing was excellent! We did the reservation online and tha price was incredible

Reviews.Title: “Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: enzo328
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I stay at the Grand Hotel Esplanade, this time in an Executive Suite. We travelled with our 3-year old son, and then it's nice to have a separate bedroom. I think the standard, service and facilities are excellent in this hotel, and the value for money you get here are among the best I've experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent – but not walking distance from down town”
Reviews.Author: Mufiin
Reviews.Content: Visited on a romantic get-away. The hotel is amazing, so beautiful, and very professional staff. The suites are diffidently worth the money, very large, and so so beautiful. The only thing wrong – so to speak – is the spa/pool area, the pool is small and boring. You have to pay extra to use the sauna, and all other facilities. The hotel is located very nice and quit, but NOT walking distance from down town. But with that said, I DEFFEINTLY RECOMMEND the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, very comfy and peaceful place”
Reviews.Author: AneriAkin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is almost perfect, the only thing I did not like so much was the location, as it is not very close to the city center, so a lot of walking was neccessary. However, everything else about the Grand hotel Esplanade is almost perfect. Rooms are huge and the bed was extremely comfortable, bathroom was great, everything very, very clean... The staff was very kind and helpful. So, despite the location, I would not mind staying here again !!!

Reviews.Title: “one of the trendiest spots in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: 37miles
Reviews.Content: a stay at Grand Hotel Esplanade Berlin is like coming home!

Reviews.Title: “A Great....”
Reviews.Author: steve_lansdell
Reviews.Content: ... base for a trip to Berlin. Very clean hotel, very helpful staff, very comfortable, great cocktails! and lovely to have a spa and pool area to relax after lots of walking. It really was the perfection location for us to to explore Berlin. Really pleased we found it. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: ELENA26Cyprus
Reviews.Content: It was a very nice hotel, with modern decoration. I didn´t expect to see such a nice lobby. Great lighting with a warm fireplace. You enjoy having a coffee at the lobby of the hotel . What I really loved was the king size bed and the cosy room. The rooms are comfortable. The hotel has a good restaurant and a great bar with live music. What I didn´t like very much is its location. You have to walk to reach the main shopping area. No very good restaurants and cafes close to the hotel. You have to walk more than ten/fifteen minutes to reach good cafes and restaurants. Tha staff was vwery friendly and helful.

Reviews.Title: “grate hotel”
Reviews.Author: stellaCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel, grate service and helpful staff. do recommend to try you will not regret. very nice rooms - clean, specially loved the fire place in the suite.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: marinakonig
Reviews.Content: we stayed in a suite and was really nice, staff was very very helpful, good food in the restaurant, breakfast very tasteful, location ok, but no free internet not even to the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Free internet”
Reviews.Author: UnaDom
Reviews.Content: I think that is the big problem that one hotel of 4 stars doesn't have free internet at least in the lobby of the hotel. Nowadays you can find internet very easy and for free and this is no matter with this hotel. For the price of the room you must offer at list free wireless internet in the lobby of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable comfort and good value”
Reviews.Author: JacktheladLondon
Reviews.Content: VERY comfortable and well-located hotel in Berlin. Rooms are immaculately clean and comfortable - it felt as if it had been especially refurbished for my arrival. Beds are incredibly comfortable, which is very important to me, especially as I have a bad back. My only criticism is that the room was too warm.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: wanderingwoofers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a New Year break and we were very impressed. Good location. Within walking distance to Ka De We and close to catch the bus to other areas. It was nice to come back after day out to the warm and comfortable reception area for coffee and cake. Cocktails in Harry's Bar were also very nice. Our room was large, clean and I've never seen so many pillows on the bed!! The staff were helpful and we would definitely return to this hotel as we loved Berlin. There is so much to do in this city and can't wait to discover more.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable”
Reviews.Author: barbyzar
Reviews.Content: good location, close to shopping mall Ka De We, nice rooms and good food.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel”
Reviews.Author: HanaPrague
Reviews.Content: We had standart room, with city view. The room was very big, comfortable, nice bathroom, big bed. Breakfast was wonderfull. Harrys bar offer big variety of coctails and there are very tasty. Staff is helpful. I recommend this hotel to everyone, who like luxury and design accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: WORLDTRAVELLERGreece
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 02/01/10 - 09/01/10, the river side room was very big and comfortable with nice bathroom too.Nice king size bed with a lot of pelows :).Big LCD TV and nice office desc.Breackfast was very tastefull and everything was every day fresch.The personal was very helpfull and in a good mude.The Harrys Bar was very good with big collection of coctails and ecxellent also.Nice location at the river of the hotel to walk if you like untill Kudamm or Potzdamer square.Not near to the hotel metro station,you need 10min for nearest.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: drmoussina
Reviews.Content: I`ll stay only in this hotel in Berlin! Excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Something of a let down.....”
Reviews.Author: sparkycurtis
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the hotel is well located and you can't help but be impressed when you arrive - the lobby area is very impressive etc. Staff are friendly and fluent in English. Check-in was not a problem. When we arrived in our room, again you could not fail to be impressed. Nice and modern looking, bathroom was a good size and very nice. The problem came when we looked out of our window - no river view as we had booked! I thought I had maybe mis-read my booking but no, I had indeed booked a "river view" room. All I could see was the back of the foyer/lobby roof all made of glass and had bright blue lights shining back at us. Now bear in mind there is no river running through Berlin, but more of a canal, I still expected more from the view from our room. Anyway, I proceeded to make my way to reception to say there must have been some mix-up with the room. The girl on reception was fairly helpfull in that she arranged for another room higher up in the hotel but did admit that none of the rooms have much of a view - bear that in mind if you think of paying the extra for the "river view"!!! Finally got our new room which did have a slightly better view, but the cleanliness was not up to the standard you would expect. Clearly some guest had children with them before us as the window in certain light was covered in small hand and finger prints. Again, not much of a problem just another little one to add to the list. Then behind the curtains at the top of the window were cobwebs which had clearly been there some time. Again, just another little problem. The bathroom was nice but we did notice drainage smells every now and then, but having stayed in many hotels in London you get used to this smell!!!! My biggest complaint comes with the lack of any supply of tea and coffee making facilities in the room. I searched high and low and could not find anything at all (other that the ridiculously over-priced mini bar!) so I contacted reception again and they confirmed they do not provide this facility. Well in all my time travelling and staying in hotels of every class/star rating known to man, I have never known not ever been supplied with this. It wouldn't be so bad if breakfast was not so expensive - somewhere in the region of £27. But the girl "helpfully" said that we could order room service of tea/coffee if we wanted!!!! Still the bottled water at £6 a throw in the room would quwnch your thirst! On a positive, the restaurants and bars in the hotel are excellent. No faults there you will be pleased to hear. Overall, we found this hotel a bit of a let-down. Just minor things that you would expect a hotel of this standard to get right. But it seems sometimes the more you pay, the less you get. But I have to say what a great place Berlin is. Fantastic at Christmas. Will definately go back, just not to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “A WARM ATMOSPHER AND EFFICIENT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: AH05
Reviews.Content: efficient and discrete service, warm atmospher, good restaurants.Very appropriate location in the center of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful gay expirence!”
Reviews.Author: Mcdo1ric
Reviews.Content: Oh, I loved this hotel. It is gay friendly as I traveled there with my man partner. The food was magnificent and the staff lovely. My only problem was who ever had the room before my man lover and I did not flush the toilet, and it made the entire room smell like a British Gay Bar. The hotel staff assisted by flushing the toilet 60 or so times and spraying some deodorant around. Love the place, will take my other lover there next month. Richard McDonald

Reviews.Title: “Great standard and people. Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: NorwegianChic
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an executive suite, and it was really nice. Staff was helpful and service minded. Good food in the restaurant. Breakfast a bit expensive (48 euros for 2 people), standard ok. Location ok, we took taxi a lot because it was freezing cold this particular weekend, but it takes about 15-20 minutes to walk to KaDeWe and Kufurstendamm. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was my favorite hotel I have stayed in the world.”
Reviews.Author: neuroDenver
Reviews.Content: The staff was efficient, friendly and graciously spoke English. I loved my view and the blue glow when I first opened my room door. The common areas were attractive and comfortable to sit in. I always felt like I was coming home.

Reviews.Title: “excellent in every respect...”
Reviews.Author: joe-at-Koenigstein
Reviews.Content: The service is excellent, at the front desk, in the restaurant, the bar and at the gym/spa. Rooms are big and clean. Breakfast is a little short but offers healthy and tasty food

Reviews.Title: “Very Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: calasona2
Reviews.Content: Overall had a very enjoyable stay at the hotel but I'm not sure it goes the extra mile to make it a 5 star. That being said we paid a very competitive rate for a juniour suite compared to some other hotels. The suite itself was beautiful and afforded a great view of the city and could not be faulted. Similarly the bar and lobby were bright and comfortable and the overall service was top class.. There are a few faults however that whould stop me recommending the place unreservedy. The price of the breakfast at €24 per head is exorbetent. My wife and I stayed for 3 nights and breakfast would have cost us just short of €150????????. I did have a look and it did look very good but not worth that. The hotel is not ideally situated and is a bit of a trek from the main sights and is not adjacent to any underground...about a 10-15 minute walk. Whilst there was a minibar in the room there was also a bottle of water left out on the sideboard. Having presumed this was complimentary We were surprised to find that we were charged for same on each night (€4 per bottle I think). This seemed unfair as there was no clear marking of pricee on the bottle and it is not unreasonable to expect it to be complmentary when not in the minibar. There is an extra charge of €9 to use the sauna...again that strikes me as expensive to say the least. The above sounds very negative which does not really reflect my view of the hotel which all in all was very good and I would consider staying there if in Berlin again especially with favourable pricing. I just feel that a few little details need to be looked at before I would class it as a true 5 star experience

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Liz0101
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nicely appointed and the staff very friendly and accommodating. However the hotel is quite a walk from the main parts of town and we didn't realise this when we booked, so that was our fault.. Also we asked for a non-smoking room on floors 1-5 when we booked but we were given a "non-smoking" room on the 7th floor. The room had a smell of cigarette smoke the whole time we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Hign standard, very comfortable, very nice room with a view”
Reviews.Author: PuechFamily
Reviews.Content: After a full day in Berlin with rain and cold, it was a great comfort to come back in our beautiful room, have a hot bath and dinner at the Eck or in the Lobby. Very good food, lovely sweets, and warm atmosphere. In the morning the breakfast was a great treat. For sure we'll come back on our next trip to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Entering the lobby you immediately get a warm welkom feeling, due to the relaxed presence of both staff and guests.”
Reviews.Author: mark_bennebroek
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the styling of the hotel, modern and warm. The staff was very friendly and helpfull. The concierge helped us excellently with tickets to the opera. The room was comfortable. Good beds, nicely made up every day. Good shower. Folding curtains were for styling only, would have been nice to use as in-betweens for privacy. What stood out was the way the lobby was made. One of the few hotels where it is fun to relaxe/lounge in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel,- fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: Danja6973
Reviews.Content: Although the area in which the hotel is situated is slightly boring, we nonetheless recommend Esplanade Hotel. Beautiful rooms, fantastic staff, incredible breakfast :o)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant weekend”
Reviews.Author: Birdpass
Reviews.Content: Comfortable hotel in quiet part of Berlin met our expectations. Pluses: excellent breakfast, friendly staff, comfortable room, clean bathroom, location Minuses: paid internet, pretty small swimming pool, expensive parking

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to combined luxury living and citypulse”
Reviews.Author: SwedenCouple
Reviews.Content: Our intention was to live luxury for some days in a nice suite with good service. We succeeded in our intetion staying in a suite with sauna.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything, relaxing atmosphere, delightful staff”
Reviews.Author: burleygriffin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for only one night in late October 2009. The hotel is on the southern edge of the Tiergarten, which is just out of range of walking to see the Reichstag, Brandenburg Gate, Unter den Linden and Potsdamer Platz. As I arrived in the afternoon, and would have to leave for the airport by check-out time at 12.00pm the next day, I had limited time to get out and about, and the staff at the hotel were extremely helpful in getting me oriented, providing maps and advice on the easist transport options - which turned out to be the day pass on the no. 100 bus. The hotel itself is reassuringly five-star plush, quiet, clean and comfortable. My only gripe - reflected in the score for the rooms - was that I had requested a non-smoking room and was advised on check-in that I had been allocated one. Sadly, despite this, the room stank from the previous occupant, and opening windows was not possible, as they open only a few inches. I suggested that smoking in non-smoking rooms should be enforced more in my exit survey. I was also slightly disconcerted that my non-smoking room was on the 6th floor - which is a smoking floor. Getting from the room to the elevator and back was not pleasant. Standards generally are very high: the rooms and beds are very comfortable, room service was efficient and friendly, breakfast was varied, plentiful and high-quality. The staff, as previously stated, were very friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “As Grand as its name!”
Reviews.Author: anniaathens
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in Grand Hotel Esplanade for 6 nights last December. We booked our room from the hotel's site and got a very good deal of 90 euro per night for a "river side view" room. The Grand Hotel Esplanade is mostly a business hotel. Nevertheless we felt very comfortable returning every night in our casual clothes while welldressed businessmen were having a drink in the hotel's bar. The hotel's lobby is very nicely decorated and warm so it is ideal for a drink, if you happen to be too tired to go out. The room was very spacious and stylish, with a great view of the river. It was exactly as it looked on the hotel's photogallery and that was a pleasant surprise. Even though it was winter and almost 0' degrees celcius outside, the room was very very warm. The bed was huge and comfortable. Bed linen and towels were changed on a daily basis and in general the room was very clean. The hotel's location - even though not very central - was quite convenient, about 7-8 minutes walk from the nearest metro station (Nollendorfplatz) and about 25 minutes walk from Potzdamer Platz. The only fault I can find for this hotel is the fact that it did not have free internet in the room, which was very strange for a business hotel. Maybe now, a year later, this has changed. I would definately recommend Grand Hotel Esplanade if you don't mind not being very centrally located. It is definately worth its price and more.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel Centrally located!”
Reviews.Author: JanetJulia
Reviews.Content: My husband was participating in the Berlin Marathon and we found that the Esplanade was a perfectly situated accomodation for us. He could easily get to the registration and start line, while my 2 daughters (ages 11 and 8) could easily enjoy the sights, and the pool/spa. The rooms (we had a Jr. Suite) were quiet, clean, and spacious; the staff was knowledgable; and we enjoyed the choice of restaurants and lounge which were available to us within the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel to stay at berlin!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dimitriosp
Reviews.Content: we stay at esplanade for five nights.the room was spacious and the bed was comfortable.the breakfast was very good.the gym was great but the pool was small...any way this hotel was really good!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice!!!”
Reviews.Author: Elenii
Reviews.Content: A luxurious, wonderfully decorated hotel right in the heart of Berlin ! The rooms were spacious and comfortable and the staff were polite and helpful! The service in general was that of a five star hotel with taxis always available at the entrance. Breakfast was maybe the second best of all the places we've ever been to!! If we ever go back to Berlin we'd definitely return! If you're ever there make sure you spend some tine at the spa! The massages are really worth trying!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Girona-CAT
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the centre of Berlin. Wonderful rooms with a spectacular window.

Reviews.Title: “good value accomodation”
Reviews.Author: frasermshaw
Reviews.Content: Not a 5 star but nevertheless good value - so priced about right - the bar was extortionate 12 euros for a G and T! - rooms were nice -staff were friendly - one thing though its on a 1 way road so it will cost about 10 euros for a taxi to go anywhere in the city. This effectively raises the cost of the room by at least 20 euros per day! Also WIFI costs were prohibitive - it was actually cheaper to use my mobile conection at 5 pounds per day!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: confident-swe
Reviews.Content: Great hotel to a great price. 1,101kr/room including breakfast is a bargain to good to resist!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel comfortable, modern and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: jerrytomsolo
Reviews.Content: Our room very quiet and comfortable - it was quite hot outside - but they have good a/c here and our room was an oasis I liked the swimming pool and workout area too. We learned to use the buses and subways in Berlin and they are typically very good. Restaurant is somewhat expensive but very good food there Berlin is a great city - do not miss the Gemaldegalerie and the Kunstgewerb Museums in the nearby Kulturforum

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, I was able to get a discount on rooms, last four nights of a three week trip.”
Reviews.Author: trippy1skye
Reviews.Content: Swimming pool was good, food expensive, Bruno in Eck Restaurant was a nice and helpful waiter. I would have liked a room with two beds, the queen was not comfortable for two adults. We did have connecting rooms the other had two beds. This was helpful with the two young children-7 and 8 years old. Refrigerator was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: ParisChrisparis
Reviews.Content: always nice people at service in the hotel always at your attention very good sauna nice view from the zimmer well located in town maybe the price of side prestations are somewhat excessive such as breakfast at 24 € ( but it is excellent ..... ) and wifi at 19,95 e which is definitely too much !!! Otherwise thank you for a nice stay in Berlin !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, nothing bad. Just an average hotel”
Reviews.Author: nyoptstrdr177
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for only 4 days in April to visit extended family while in Berlin and to take in a show. Overall, we felt comfortable in this hotel but it does not represent the best of values for the price. A "breakfast" is included with an upgrade for 15 Euros ($24) per day per person. Not worth the expense. The buffet felt like a school cafeteria and the ambiance was dated 1970's. Food was better than most German hotels, meaning you actually get to eat eggs and bacon and have some variety but not worth the $24 per person per night. Take note- typical breakfast in Germany for $20 is a couple slices of bread, Nutella, Nutella, and more Nutella. Perhaps if you are lucky, a couple of slice of salami or cheese. Overall, I can't complain. It served a purpose and we were upgraded because they overbooked the hotel due to some special event taking place that week. The room was fairly clean and newer. The room had a musty odor but to the eye it was clean. Bathroom is decent size and also clean. The A/C unit was non-functioning all the time but as with most hotels in Germany, you are lucky to even have climate control in the room. There is an indoor swimming pool which was again clean but the hotel staff keep a close eye on you and you feel as if you are being watched the whole time. My wife felt uncomfortable with the one staff member always watching her walk. Overall, if the price was better we might consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Security nightmare”
Reviews.Author: mbgandco
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel until it has completely reviewed its security arrangements. I recently stayed at the hotel for 2 nights on business with a number of work colleagues. In the short time we were there:- - One person had their room broken into at 1.30am and their safe stolen! Not opened but the whole safe removed. It was very poorly designed - not bolted to the wall. The doors are so poorly fitted that the police said that the robber pushed it in with ease. - Another person had their bag stolen in the restaurant. - Another person foiled an attempt to steal their bag in the cafe. It is a great shame to say this since as others have reported the Hotel is very good value with large well appointed rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: mokoma
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 2 friends and in general, we liked it, but our expectations were higher. We arrived 10.30am and got our Junior Suite right away which was great. Suite was nice, spacious and with room-long terrace. Bathroom was big and quite ok. However, it was maybe not that luxurious as they advertise. Staff forgot to bring 3rd person’s extra bed, towels, soaps etc. Fitness room was good with up-to-date equipments. Pool was small but nice and there were some beds too to take a rest. Lady at the pool side didn’t speak any English and was bit rude. Lobby area and bar downstairs didn’t leave anything to complain. Nice long-islands at the bar (13euro each). All the staff (excl. pool lady) were quite helpful. Location is between Potsdamer platz and Ku’Damm (10mins walk to both) but there is actually nothing in the closest neighborhood. There are taxis available all the time if you don’t feel like walking. My friends were charged for breakfast (24euro each) even though receptionist told me that it is included. I was pretty angry to hear that and I left complaint. After two mails they refunded it, which I appreciate a lot. Breakfast itself, I didn’t have time for it but friends told it was great! It was bit surprising that there were some extra costs, like internet 20euro/day and access to saunas 9euro/day. Didn’t expect that from 5-star hotel. Next time I’ll choose some other 5-star, let’s see how it goes. In general Berlin is really great city when it comes to accommodation. Lot of good deals all the time!

Reviews.Title: “This is a Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: peggy92
Reviews.Content: We were in Berlin for our daughter's wedding. We booked 2 rooms for 7 nights. The Esplanade is in a great location with easy access to public transportation. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We will stay here again on our next trip to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “More than perfect”
Reviews.Author: SAVVOP
Reviews.Content: Our hotel choice was made through Internet and we were afraid that things might not be as good as presented. We were lucky to have chosen this hotel, which had a great location, a variety of services (pool and SPA care should be tried!!!), rich qualitative buffet breakfast, great food at the restaurant and a nice bar. Having our young daughter with us for the first time on a trip abroad, it was an unforgetable experience. Berlin is such a family and kids' friendly city, peaceful, romantic, clean. We would like someday to go back and now we do know for sure where we will be staying!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best choice”
Reviews.Author: GeoZa
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect. Do not hesitate, if weather permits, to take a bicycle ride in Tiergarden. Also do not hesitate to ask the concierge for anything. They seem to have an answer for everything, besides being very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Privacy & Professionality”
Reviews.Author: SBSchaefer
Reviews.Content: we love the privacy of the house and its professional service

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel that exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: rozzyt
Reviews.Content: Spent a brilliant four nights at the hotel, very comfortable and stylish room with goosedowm duvets and pillows, excellent shower etc etc. We both agreed that the Breakfast was the best we had ever had at a major hotel with extensive choice in all areas. Pleasant service; really good hotel type swimmingpool and the supplied robes/slippers and lift access made it use easy.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: docmay
Reviews.Content: We went to Berlin i July for the U2 concert at Olympiastadion. We went with our grown-up son (24) and to save time ((and money) we decided to get a suite with enough room for 3 grown-ups to sleep. We got a "Berlin-get away" offer including breakfast and we had a wonderful stay. The staff was friendly and very helpful even before we arrived, as we got telephonecalls to make sure everything was in order. We got a beautiful, spacious suite, beautifully furnished and decorated with a nice view of Berlin. Huge bathroom - with nice amenities, slippers and robes. One little thing though : the water ran out from the shower leaving the floor all soaked ! But we consider that a minor detail, as there were plenty of towels to dry up for the next person to enter. Fantastic "Harry's Bar" with a huge selection of drinks at a fair price. Great food in the restaurant and an outstanding breakfast untill 12.00 am on Sunday - great as we got home from the concert pretty late !! Nice location, but a bit away from Kurfürstendamm and the whole shopping/restaurant area. Not excatly centrally located, but on the other hand there was no traffic noise or other disturbing sounds at night ! Would surely go back any time..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: redwrangler8
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel Esplanade is located in the western part of Berlin, close to the Tierpark and Ku'damm, offering views on the Siegessäule. It is a very nice and modern hotel that offers all required amenities for the business and city traveler. The rooms are spacious, clean and have a boutique appeal. There is a mini-bar, but internet access is quite pricy, as usual for business hotels. The public areas follow the same design pattern as the rooms. The staff is very efficient and professional, ideal for the business traveller. The breakfast buffet is quite appealing and offers a wide variety of high quality items. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay there and would recommend this hotel when going to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, excellent food, a little out of the way location but definitely worth it for the price.”
Reviews.Author: travel_bug_0077
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - very clean, spacious rooms, very good restaurant and bar selection. Only downfall is that it is convenient to the Zoo but a far walk to a lot of the other attractions Berlin has to offer. If you are travelling without a child and can easily jump into a taxi then this is definitely a wonderful hotel for you! Everything else about it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with perfect service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: MoscowAlexandra
Reviews.Content: Friendly ready to help immediately staff. Everywhere, in the restaurant, at the reception and at housekeeping. My room with a view to the city was wonderful, I had very nice bed with two blankets as I asked during my online booking. The room with lots of light and decoration was nice. A bathroom was very comfortable too. No broken things in the room, I really felt like I was at home. Location was ok with me as I prefer walking a lot. I like that hotel is near to the park. I can't even say anything which I dislike about hotel... But apart from room I also enjoyed my breakfast which was just perfect, I couldn't stop eating:)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Esplanade is extremely friendly, good value for money and I would have no hesitation in recommending it to anyone”
Reviews.Author: Rafaelraglan
Reviews.Content: All hotel staff were very helpful and friendly, the room was excellent and we enjoyed the restaurant, bar area, live music and swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “I though it is one of Grand Hyatt group and 5-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: MohammedOman
Reviews.Content: I was in hurry to go to Germany and I have book this hotel I though it is one of grand Hyatt group which it was not. Also I though it is fie stars hotel then it turn this hotel is not officially rank. However they claim it is operating as five star hotels. I like this comment anyhow eventually I did not regretted staying in this hotel. I was lucky enough that hotel was actually very nice. Grand Hotel Esplanade Hotel is really romantic and charming place. I will write up about reception, Room, fitness center and spa, restaurant and staff. Unfortunately I was so busy that I could not say much longer in hotel during my visit to Berlin. I have arrived quite early in hotel where my reservations have not started yet. However Staff was so welcomed and warm. They allowed leaving my bags for couple hours. I stayed in Hotel for 1 week. Room was so clean and big. However bathroom was cleaned and oks nothing else special. Bed was Ok. TV channel ok most of them Germany channel so I could not understand them thanks for one news Arabic channel. . In general room was very good. Although Fitness center was ok it is equipped with essential practicing machine. Spa looked nice but I have not tried it. Swimming pool is so medium but nice. Restaurant is very charming and very good services. I had every days Breakfast. Food and drinks are nicely displayed. I like strawberry were very delicious. Staffs were really incredible and understanding. They were always there. I like every thing in hotel except that internet rate was not included with room rate and I believe it was quite costly. It is close to zoo. it is also close to Turkish market. It is close to down town. it is very close tomain park.

Reviews.Title: “Everything OKAY!”
Reviews.Author: Macx24
Reviews.Content: Congratulations to the Esplanade Team. I enjoyed four days in this hotel and there were no open wishes. Thanky you!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - but a lot of hidden extras”
Reviews.Author: Joxerdublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in a penthouse room at the Esplanade and while the hotel is very nice and typical of five star standard I found that there were a lot of hidden extra charges such as 20Euro per 24hours of wi-fi, 9Euro to use the sauna per go and a whopping 24Euros extra for breakfast each day. I think that there is better five star value to be had in Berlin in hotels with much better locations. One final gripe about this hotel is that it is not really very close by foot to shopping and restaurants etc... If I was returning to Berlin I would probably give the Kempinski a go next time instead.

Reviews.Title: “good services so-so location”
Reviews.Author: barbarolla
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers good services and nice serving. breakfast is really good and has a variety of choices. However location is not ideal for those who wish to spend in the chic east part.

Reviews.Title: “Good 4 stars hotel with minor imperfections”
Reviews.Author: mmiggl
Reviews.Content: Location is in between former center of east Berlin and former center of West Berlin which allow you to reach either of the center in a 20 minutes walk. The subway is easy to use and there is a subway station at 10 minutes by walk. Superb is you want to jog in Tiergarten park. Rooms are spacious, comfortable, silencious and cleanly decorated. Pool is a good place to swim and relax on one of the relaxing chairs after a long day in Berlin (if not too busy). Do not know about the breakfast because too expensive (24€). But there is a small "coffee to go" shop at 3 minutes by walk with excellent coffee, sandwiches etc. Terrace before the lobby (in summer only I guess) is not inviting because it is noisy and the hotel should not allow cars to park there to avoid that place looking like a garage entrance. But at the price we got (average of 114 €/night) it was a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: PradaP
Reviews.Content: We had a very good stay at the Grand Hotel Esplanade and we would happily recommend it.. room was clean and well decorated and had a good view and the beds were comfortable. Bathroom was very good too. Breakfast and service were both very good, location is not the most central but it was not a problem...it is basically a big, efficient luxury business hotel so don't go expecting much personality, but it served us well and we were very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, never let the valet park your right hand drive.”
Reviews.Author: futuremrschalky
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in the hotel, the staff were pleasant and accommodating. We took our car and let the valet park it, when we got the car 2 days later, the valet bought it up, he was revving the car a bit high, we though it a bit odd at the time, but when we got in the car we noticed the smell of a burning clutch. We had appointment's in the city, so we thought we would complain on the way back. We did this, as the smell was still there some 40 minute drive later. I can only say that they never appologised to us for burning the clutch on a new car, with only 1000 miles on the clock. And they cannot use the language difference as an excuse as my friend was there to translate, and she is a local girl. I found this upset an otherwise perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “We felt pampered!”
Reviews.Author: junsix
Reviews.Content: The hotel is convenient to public transportation, which was critical for us while we were in Berlin. (The bus and train system there are clean, well-run, and easy to navigate.) It was also right next to the Tiergarten, and a fairly easy walk to the Victory Column and Brandenberg Tor. The desk clerks were very polite and helped us choose walking routes, places for dinner, etc. The breakfast buffet is the biggest I'd ever seen, with a massive variety of hot and cold items, along with newspapers in various languages. The indoor pool was the perfect way to relax after walking all over this amazing city. The rooms were clean, as was the entire hotel. We would love to go back someday!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: corneredmouse
Reviews.Content: A thoroughly modern hotel. Stylish, spotless, comfortable, friendly. Everything you would expect from a 5 star hotel coupled with German efficiency. The staff could not have been more friendly or accomodating, the room looked as if we were the very first guests to stay in it. Harry's Bar does a really good Pina Colada. All in all, one of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed in. My wife and I already want to go back to Berlin and stay again and we've never stayed in the same hotel twice.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkHeather
Reviews.Content: There wasn't one thing I would change. A most wonderful experience-from the cordial staff, large and beautiful rooms to the chocalate at end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “very good address”
Reviews.Author: xam2
Reviews.Content: the situation of the hotel is convenient near the water and park, but has the advantage of a well known bar/lounge which gives the hotel popularity for a continuous inner-city feeling, weather you enjoy the open outside cafe or an indoor late club, but doesn't effect the privacy of your room.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: worldFrequentguest
Reviews.Content: Just plain fantastic. Great beds, very good showers, quite etc and as if we where in a different planet..........very friendly and lovely people trying to make your stay speacial!! The word service is below of what we experienced! So all in all a hotel without a known name but much much better than all the hotels with a name. I would recommend it to all but please don't all come togehter and leave no rooms for us!!

Reviews.Title: “nothing but good things about Esplanade; will do it again!”
Reviews.Author: HCBruins
Reviews.Content: Nice (modern) hotel, great loungy entrance, good outside terrace. Friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Esplanade is Excellent”
Reviews.Author: tomlor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were coming back to Berlin from Paris. We had a wonderful night at the Espalanade. Staff was exceptional, thye made sure I had Champagne and Strawberries in the room upon arrival as I requested in an email. Spa was relaxing, food was savory and the staff made us feel at home! We would definitely reccommend your hotel to our friends and family! Danke Schoen!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, superb location, superb staff.”
Reviews.Author: patsy40
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights with 2 small children and the hotel was fabulous. Could not have asked for more - rooms were spacious and staff were polite and always had a smile of their face. Only 1 little gripe - spa pool was freezing!!

Reviews.Title: “If you want service, stay somewhere else...”
Reviews.Author: StinaSweden
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Grand Hotel Esplanade this weekend. It was a birthdaytrip, celebrating my fathers 70´th birthday. We´d booked 2 junior suites at the hotels website. Service was bad from the moment we arrived. Bad check in, rude personel at the Ellipse lounge. When the room finally was ready they forgot to notice us. Complimentary "birthdayfruit" - one banana, three apples and a plum... Got alkoholic drinks when I asked for non-alcoholic (pregnant). There were no smiling faces, no greetings. If you asked for something, you only got short and rude anwers. Did not apoplogize for mistakes etc.. Never been treated like this before at a 3-5 star hotel Turndown service at 17.00 or not at all. The room was nice though amd the breakfast was very good. Small but nice things to eat. The location is ok. Good, but expensive drinks at Harry´s bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Pity about the beds”
Reviews.Author: britmal
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good value for money and whilst you had to travel (some what) to get to the sights, it was convientley located between the two major centers of Berlin. Our personal only problem was that as both of us are back suffer, the beds and pillows were soft...but thats a problem in pretty much all western hotels. This being our only concern, overall this hotel is highly recommendable to all.

Reviews.Title: “'Ich bin ein Berliner'”
Reviews.Author: CostasMarlen
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 days with my wife and a couple of friends AND LOVED IT! A real penthouse at the 7th floor with terrific view, clean and spacious, a real concierge quick with answers, suggestions and humour - thank you Johnny! an excellent restaurant - Eck's , a lively bar - Harry' s and a warm modern style highly appreciated by someone as classic as myself!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a Fantastic Price”
Reviews.Author: Scottraveller6
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i stayed here for three nights mid january. The entrance to the hotel is lovely with seating area for the good weather. Reception staff were polite and helpful and we were allowed to check in early. The rooms too were great, and well decorated, the decor was modern and neutral, the rooms were a reasonable size and warm especially for the cold jan weather, the beds were comfortable. We never ate the breakfast as it was extremely overpriced and instead we would eat elsewhere. The hotel has a few restaurants and bars, we had a drink in harrys bar, which too was modern but again was very expensive. The location is the hotel main negative, it is situated between the tourist sights and the shopping/restaurant area but is quite a walk to both. It is about ten min walk up to kadewa (large shopping centre) and other shops and restaurants. It is a good 20min walk to reichstag and brandenburg gate and even further to checkpoint charlie etc. I would recommend this hotel as it is clean, well priced and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ddrak
Reviews.Content: Based on my experience as a frequent traveler abroad I have to say that this hotel is one of the best in its category. I stay there on 15-18 April 2009 (3 nights). In summary, I provide you some of its key points: 1. Very clean & comfort rooms 2. State of art gym and pool. It has professional gym machines (for them that they know what I am talking about) 3. The hotel is just 2 min walk from the bus stop 100 which stops in many attraction locations including Alexanderplatz. 4. For those that prefer to use train, the nearest station is about 7 min away (Noolendorfplatz). If you follow the Maabenstrabe street (that is across the station) you will find many good value cafes & restaurants. 5. There are also some restaurants & cafes very close to the hotel (if you walk around the area that the hotel is located you can easily find them) 6. To & From Tegal airport, get a taxi, it was only around 16 – 17 euros. 7. Buy the city tour cart (by this way you can save money when using the public transport & get great discounts in many tourist attractions) 8. The last point that I have read in some previous reviews concerns the complains for the lack of tea/coffee making facilities. The only country that hotels offer tea/coffee making facilities is England. In Germany and in many, many more other European countries people do not expect this service even when visiting a 5 star hotel. The only disanointing point that I noticed was the limited availability of English speaking films in the payTV. I would expect sth more concerning this service.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel but Definitely Not 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: ScarlettDerry
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is not ideal and there did not appear to be any restaurants really nearby. The nearest restaurants and bars seem to be at Postdamer Platz which is about a 15 minute walk and is pleasant enough. On its advertising information the hotel emphasises the panoramic windows in the bedrooms which have amazing views over the city of Berlin. Our view was of a side street and a tall building across the road. It turned out to be a blessing that we did not have a great view as we had to keep the curtains closed the whole time to try and keep the room cooler as the air conditioning didn’t work. We did point out to the hotel that the air conditioning wasn’t working and they didn’t seem that interested and didn’t fix it. They gave us a tiny fan which was basically useless. This wasn’t the standard of service you would have expected from a 5 star hotel. It was very difficult to sleep in such a hot room. On the positive side the bedroom and bathroom were quite nice, although not 5 star standard. However the bedroom did not have any tea/coffee making facilities nor did the bathroom have any shower caps. The bar, reception and outside seating areas were nice. Check in and out were both handled efficiently. All in all a reasonable hotel but if you are expecting 5 star luxury then you will probably be disappointed. Nearly forgot - the swimming pool is tiny.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous Hotel, great relaxing hotel to go back to after sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: DerbyshireLottie
Reviews.Content: I think this was the comfiest bed i have ever slept in! Rooms were clean, had all the amenities you needed. After a hard day sightseeing the pperfect place to relax. A bit of a walk to either Nollendorf Platz and Potsdamer Platz stations (10 mins) but taxis in abundance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel not close to anything”
Reviews.Content: Modern Hotel – probably mainly catering for conventions. While the Hotel is nice there really is very little available in walking distance. If you like to use Public transport the very regular 100 bus stops very close to the Hotel and goes to all the main tourist sites in Berlin. The main shopping area is a good 15 minutes walk or a short taxi ride. Rooms are nice and modern if not a little too warm overnight. Internet access is expensive at €19.95 per 24h and room service selection is very limited and also expensive. There are nice bars and restaurants in the Hotel all with a very contemporary feel. Rooms are spacious modern and comfortable. Staff overall very helpful and freindly

Reviews.Title: “Good location & good service”
Reviews.Author: romain524
Reviews.Content: The location is nice, and close to Kundam for shopping. The service is great especially at the Frontdesk. Special thanks to the Concierge who help us to find good a good bar and a good restaurant. The bar inside the hotel is good too with a large choice of cocktail. The Breakfast room is great and the quality of food too. The rooms are contemporary with full equipment. Nothing bad in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “absolutely loved it”
Reviews.Author: FGO
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome!! we went in winter and our room was very cheap (only 90 euros per night). The rooms were incredible, i loved everything, the bed, the bathroom, the pilows, the view, EVERYTHING. It was perfect, comfortable, like being in heaven. The restaurant that was in the lobby was really good and the food was tasty. The attention was good. The only thing bad about it was the elevator, it was always full and sometimes we had to wait from 5 to 10 minutes for it and it was very annoying. Also the swimming pool in the spa was very cold! In order to get to the nearest subway station, you need to walk like 10 minutes. I would recommend this hotel with my eyes closed, because the rooms and the service are trully amazing

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: HeidiOslo
Reviews.Content: A beatuiful hotel, we loved it! Me and my 2 boys, 12 and 13 years had a fantastic big room. The room felt very new and clean. We used the swimmingpool, gym and spa. It was great! We took the bus numer 100 (a local bus), the bus is stopping just 3 minutes to walk from the hotel, and the bus is going to many of the major tourist atractions between Zoological garden and Alexanderplatz. We bought bus tickets at the airport and could use this for 3 days for train, buses in Berlin. I like this city and will come back. This hotel is woderful, and the price for us 3 was nice for a 5 stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Superb , Top of the line, Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Divadivadiva
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just amazing. We only stayed for 2 nights, but I wish we could've stayed longer. From the time we checked in, until we checked out, there was nothing but the best in hotel standards that one can provide. The Grand Suite was breath taking and the music in Harry's is so warm and comforting. Other hotels need to look at the service provided here as you get much more service for your money. That's so important. So thanks to the management and staff for such excellent hospitality ! D.Stovall

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, not first class”
Reviews.Author: aussiefrequentflyer
Reviews.Content: A stylish and well appointed hotel with quality service and a great sense of space, lacking a few touches that keep it from being a highly regarded 5-star hotel, probably more 4.5 star...excellent value that we would return to. The rooms are very well decorated in a modern style, and given the location, most would feature a leafy view. Rooms on the North side of the hotel look out to the lovely tree-lined canal across the road. Service is prompt, courteous and helpful. The indoor pool is part of a day spa and is a beautiful quiet space. The gym has an excellent array of machines and weights with a leafy outlook from 15-foot windows. Bicycles are available from the hotel to enjoy the surrounding suburbs, (featuring the consulate district) and the stunning Tiergarten nearby. We ate only at the breakfast restaurant which we would rate very good but not excellent. A large, light & airy room with huge celings, it offers an excellent complete range of breakfast offerings, including egg dishes made to order, however the quality falls slightly short of the standard that would make this an excellent breakfast banquet. While it's not close to the downtown attractions, the quiet and spacious ambience, great value, and short walk to the beautiful Tiergarten and Berlin Victory Column make this a great-value destination

Reviews.Title: “5 star value for money”
Reviews.Author: tduck
Reviews.Content: We got a good 'winter warmer' deal earlier this month which was great value for money. The hotel is clean and organised as expected. Everybody is friendly and a mine for great advice. When we came to check out we had the sauna on our bill when it was part of the deal but that caused no confusion and was an honest mistake by the staff. Sauna and pool are great. They also have a nice bar on site, if somewhat a little overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel Espanlade”
Reviews.Author: steveb872
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, excellent room, very well placed, 15 min walk to Potsdam and 10 mins to the zoo and Ka De We (huge department store) on the main street in the West. Price of food, drink, mini bar etc in the hotel were expensive but it is 5 star so it's to be expected. Over all would highly recommend this hotel. Staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very efficient and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ellam8
Reviews.Content: We stopped off in Berlin on the last leg of our jaunt around central europe and we thought that we would go five star. This place is immaculately cleaned and organised. The staff were really helpful (gave us advice on local restaurants). We didn't have breakfast there as it cost too much. For our city view room for 99 Euros we got the use of sauna free - which was nice. The pool was available for everybody in the hotel. A bit small but fine for a hotel pool. The location was quiet and near many other hotels and easily accessible to all major sites - tourist and shopping in Berlin. Good hotel if you want the massive 7 floor hundreds of rooms place.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Place”
Reviews.Author: jt0475
Reviews.Content: Managed to bag a bargain through using Airmiles to pay for the hotel. Very impressed - contempory rooms, lovely court area to have a relaxing drink in. Very well situated - only 5 mins walk from the southern side of the Tiergarten, and from there, you're within 15mins stroll of the very heart of the city. Public transport connections OK - bus stops within 5 mins walk as well.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good”
Reviews.Author: DougaltheCat
Reviews.Content: This hotel did not quite live up to the expectations we have of a good 5 star hotel when compared to other hotels in this category. The room was very pleasant - spacious and well decorated with an attractive view. The only thing that let it down was the extraordinarily low light levels in the main room area. Reading a book while lying in bed was all that could feasibly be managed. The staff were very helpful and friendly. This was particularly appreciated because my husband had an injured knee and the staff at the door were quick to notice this and help when they could. We were very disappointed in the quality of the breakfast. The range of food was more limited than that we had come to expect in this class of hotel. Of the food provided the pastries were poor quality (this is surprising in a city that has high quality pastries in most cafes) and the one time one of us had a pancake it was doughy and stodgy. Given that breakfast is the one meal that we generally rely on having at the hotel we were very disappointed. We found the quality of food in the other restaurant's to be good.

Reviews.Title: “I expected more”
Reviews.Author: Pete30
Reviews.Content: I suppose it's just the little things that get to me, but I expected a bit more from this hotel. The price for the rooms was quite good, but it was December so I would expect that. The price for everything else in the hotel was outrageous, and the facilities in the rooms were not up to what I would expect A small beer was €5, breakfast was €24 euro, small bottle of water was €6. All of this I might expect in the centre of London, but this was Berlin, where I thought it would be slightly more reasonable. Add to this the fact that I had to get someone to come and fix the tv when we arrived, I had to call housekeeping twice to deliver 1 item, and that there was no tea making facilities or ironing board in the room meant that I was disappointed overall.

Reviews.Title: “Had an excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: BudgeLincoln
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a Travelzoo offer and received free upgrade, half price breakfast, free sauna and free late checkout. I e-mailed them to request the upgrade as we were in Berlin to celebrate my husbands borthday, and they obliged immediately, when we checked in they shook my husband's hand and wished him a happy birthday, they had 'happy birthday' across the bed when we arrived in our room, which was excellent. We had a lovely breakfast on both days, but took our evening meal when we were out as the food was a little expensive, but I have to say that our overall experience was very good and we would certainly recommend the hotel. Tried both the sauna and pool, and found all of the staff to be very friendly and obliging

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, except totally overpriced”
Reviews.Author: blazingsunshine
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. The room was big, decorated superbly, very very comfy beds - almost too comfy to get out of in fact! The staff were generally ok - however, when we put a 'do not disturb' sign on the door after a night out, instead of knocking they rang the phone repeatedly until we answered! Not exactly undisturbed..... The location of the hotel is good. It is about 5 minutes walk to the train station where you can connect to a number of different lines. The main tourist atttractions are very accessible. From Tegal airport, just jump in a taxi, it was only around 16 euros and hasslefree. The main problems with this hotel is that for a 5 star, you really expect some things to be included. Breakfast for example was not included and was 24 euros per person in the hotel! Water was 6 euros! It really was outrageously priced and for somewhere so lavish, I really expected at least the water to be free! Anyway, overall a very good hotel, worth the room rate. Let down by high prices of food and drink on arrival/in the room/room service. And some of the staff on reception could be rather rude. We asked for a late check out and you would have thought we had asked for her to kiss our feet, with the look she gave us!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ZafToronto
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. 2 of us from the same company were in Berlin for work and we booked a suite instead of 2 separate rooms. The suite was huge, had 2 separate bedrooms and bathrooms and a large living area with 2 desks for work. The cost was just slightly higher than 2 regular rooms. The service was fantastic and overall a great stay at the hotel. I would recommend this hotel and if there are several people staying at the same hotel, check out the suites before booking separate rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great beds great bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: swismis
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for work. Price very reasonable. Great beds and bathrooms. TVs with movies and nice fitness center. Great front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Berlin Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelElixirofLife
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 8 days at the Grand Hotel Esplanade. I booked directly through their website in early September at a great rate for this caliber of hotel, and it was even more than I expected. It's an excellent location for visiting all of Berlin, the U-station is a 10 minute walk, and there are some great bars and restaurants within easy walking distance of the hotel. The hotel itself was outstanding - large rooms, deliciously comfortable beds, quiet, exceptionally clean, outstanding pool and fitness center. We had a river view room, which I recommend as it lived up to its name. We didn't opt for the pricey/touristy breakfast package and were happier without it, walking to Einstein Cafe or Impala each morning for the best coffees and hot chocolate, salmon bagels, apple strudel, museli, croissants. There's also a little coffee/sandwich shop around the corner at the back of the hotel if you need a quick latte and croissant before heading out. While the Grand Hotel is probably - as one tour book says - more of an "American style" deluxe hotel, for the price and location it more than met all of our needs for this trip and would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: FlyLudo
Reviews.Content: Nice and functional hotel in between 2 of the 'centres' of Berlin. Friendly and helpful staff. Some coffee or tea making facilities (increasingly standard) would be nice in such quality hotel. The expensive breakfast has nice alternatives at just a 5 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ppmac
Reviews.Content: We had to move here from the Bleibtreu (which was terrible) & we had a great time. The check in was a breeze & the staff were excellent. The room was spacious & well appointed with a great view of the canal. The beds were very comfortable & bathroom was good. The service was truly exceptional. I needed a printout of my air ticket after midnight & got it in a few minutes from the front desk. The location is pretty good with the hotel centrally located from the shopping areas & the historic areas.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Superb”
Reviews.Author: benny21
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in August 2008 with 3 friends and I can safely say that it is one of the absolute best hotels I have ever stayed in! Almost every single thing was perfect. The rooms were beautiful - very tastefully decorated, and the beds were unbelievably comfortable! The TV in the room is huge, and gives a good variety of channels in various languages! The window was also enormous, which allowed in a lot of natural light, which I enjoyed. The window's also appear shiny on the exterior so there is no need to worry about anybody looking in to your room from the street or an adjacent building. The staff were all also incredibly polite and helpful. Upon check-in, we did have a slight problem regarding a deposit. However, this was easily overlooked by how easily it was sorted out and the politeness of the receptionist with whom we were dealing. Within the hotel, there are 4 different restaurants/bars. Elements is the breakfast restaurant, and although we did not have breakfast in the hotel any of our 5 mornings there, we were impressed just by how beautiful and sophisticated it appeared. The Eclipse Lounge was a very relaxed section within the lobby. We ate in the hotel one night - in Eck Kneipe. This I would say was the only down side to the whole hotel. The standard of the food was just not what we expected at all and we did not finish our meal, however the staff were very friendly and polite. Harry's New York Bar is a sophisticated cocktail bar, mentioned in many of the city's tourist guides, and we understood why. The cocktails are rather expensive, but were definitely worth it!! Once again, the staff were incredibly friendly, and we ended up in Harry's at some point every night of our stay. The location of the hotel is also very good. A short walk from the Zoo, the Kaiser Wilhelm Gedaechtniskirche and the Kurfuerstendamm, and right next to the Tiergarten. Potsdamer Platz is also walking distance. However, there was always taxis outside the hotel for those in a hurry. The rest of the hotel facilities we used were also of the highest standard. The pool area was lovely and the gym facilities were state of the art! We also availed of room service one evening, the the food was simply delicious!! I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anybody!! It was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: unx
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel, well worth its 5 star rating. Staff are helpful and the room is fantastic with comfy beds, great pillows and an amazing shower! Location is ok, not in the city centre, but there is plenty around...ask the hotel staff, they are more than happy to tell you what is close by! Hire a bike from the hotel for €15 and the location of the hotel is not an issue at all!

Reviews.Title: “Sweat over small stuff”
Reviews.Author: SpicySugar
Reviews.Content: The room was superb and the service is good as you would expect from a 5 star hotel. Only 2 things I wasnt quite happy about: - no complimentary water. They left 1 bottle of water but it is chargable at €6 - for toilettries, only provide 'hair and body shampoo' and 'body lotion' They are small issues but with the 5 star price I pay, I cant believe that they are so stingy on these small supplies! I wont stay there anymore.

Reviews.Title: “A first class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leesw8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Esplanade Grand for my first visit to Berlin. I was initially worried that I was too far from the centre, but on arrival, I found this was not the case. The hotel is a first class five star hotel opposite the Bauhaus Archiv. The special deal I had booked was an upgraded river view room for 89 euros per night - a bargain. My room on the sixth floor faced the Bauhaus, and I could see the top of the Victory Column in the distance. Clearly the rooms have been recently renovated, as the fittings were spotless and clean. Staff at Reception were very helpful. I didn't eat at the hotel, but it looked very good. Instead I had dinner at Cafe Einstein around the corner which is highly recommended. As for the distance to the centre, Nollendorfplatz U-Bahn station is about a 5 or 6 minute walk, bus 100 goes from the hotel every few minutes through the Tiergarten to the Reichstag and on to Alexanderplatz, and bus M29 goes from the hotel to the Kulturforum and Checkpoint Charlie and runs close to Potsdamer Platz. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WalesDaisy
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, well worth its 5-star rating with pool and fitness centre. I stayed there on a summer special offer - approx £70 per night. Room was very luxurious, and sparkling clean. Staff were extremely polite and helpful. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic, recommended”
Reviews.Author: ChrissySweden
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel with swift, elegant and friendly service. Not in the middle of the city but in a nice area and close to the Tiergarten which is a lovely garden to walk around in. Only aber was the breakfast which was good but more four-star than five. Go instead to the Einstein café which is just around the corner for fresh baked bread and pastries in a lovely setting.

Reviews.Title: “Spelendid and clean facility”
Reviews.Author: ofer_sutton
Reviews.Content: It was an excellent experience and great value. We paid a low rate and got a service of a real 5 star hotel. Hotel is clean, staff is very polite and helpful, location is great. Very very recommended .

Reviews.Title: “Fair hotel”
Reviews.Author: cirlu
Reviews.Content: It's a well situated hotel with very nice staff in reception. The double room we had was placed away from the street which gave a quiet room, but the neighbourgs in the building next to the hotel have free view to the rooms up to about 3. floor where we stayed. The room needed to be renovated to meet modern standards. Bathroom was definately not designed for use for more than one person at the time. Some electrical switches and outlets were loose or malfunctioning. Confronted with this, the hotel fixed the problems within the next day. Bed was very comfortable. Breakfast was the best hotel breakfast so far in Germany. Hotel bar and restaurant was at an average level. Might go there again if they had a "hot deal".

Reviews.Title: “Fantastically swanky!”
Reviews.Author: vicki1978
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through lastminute.com and was amazed at the cheap deal that we got - we paid about £160 for 2 nights. The hotel is 5* and is completely luxurious - very modern and swanky. It seems to cater mainly for the business end of the market and we felt like a couple of scruff bags trotting in with our rucksack, whilst everyone else was making full use of the very smartly dressed porters with their enormous cases. However the staff were very welcoming and were always on hand to offer whatever service you required. Our room was enormous - however we did have a city view which was slightly misleading as it actually looked straight across the road to another hotel or office block - you can pay a little more for a river view which is probably worth it. The hotel has several bars and restaurants - there were all really nice, although quite expensive - the hotel is also home to Harry's Bar - one of Berlin's top bars which is in lots of the guide books (as is the hotel under the luxury section). It also has a really nice pool and gym. The location of the hotel is pretty good - not far from Berlin's Tiergarten and only a five minute walk from the nearest underground station. It is surrounded by embassy buildings and is close to several bars and restaurants. We had a fantastic stay at the Grand Hotel Esplanade and would thoroughly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ddddddddddd
Reviews.Content: If you like bland, you are on business and expenses this is probably for you. Otherwise we found it disappointing. First the good bit:the waiting staff and food are excellent and reasonably priced for a 5*. We stay in Berlin 4/5 times a year. Last we had a quite exceptional fixed price lunch at the Esplanade (Euros70). ..though we only discovered they did it by accident. Not advertised .We liked the foyer design and the waiting staff were friendly so we decided to try a room. They no longer do that lunch deal and have closed the Michelin starred restaurant (Vivos) . We booked online through the hotel site. A junior suite on a package that included b'fast and use of sauna. When we arrived there was a problem with the booking...others here have also had problems we see. Initially the receptionists seemed to sort it but then said the rate would be higher...by this time they had my CC...when I asked how much they said they didn't know. After some discussion they got their boss who was very helpful. Mysteriously he came up with a totally different rate....though not a package one. If we had used the sauna as intended we would have paid overall a little more. The difference was Euros20ish so I said that was fine, checked it again and wrote it down on the room card. The Junior suites are on the top ..7th floor. Superficially the are very attractive ...good colour palette, lots of space and individual terraces. However the views don't include any of Berlin's sights as they are the back of the hotel...why they arn't at the front overlooking the canal and on to Potsdamer Platz is a complete mystery. The suites quickly become annoying. There is no hanging space in the entrance lobby so you have to take (wet) coats right to the wardrobes past a narrow choke point with the bed/desk. The bathroom is poorly laid out...double basins but no worksurface space. The loo is situated so you can be seen from the bed if you leave the door ajar. However designed them should return their fee. It is impossible to pass a member of staff at our normal hotels in Berlin without being pleasantly greeted......here we found some of the domestic staff surly. Evening room service was far too early. It's the only time I have not left a room tip in many years. The sauna is very clean as is the pool but totally impersonal....there is no bar and is just not a place to relax. You actually enter through an unmarked door in the basement which sets the tone. The lounge area is wonderfully designed...but the open fire and heating are insufficient to allow one to dwell on a cold night over a nightcap. The B'fast restaurant is impersonal and not designed for a lingering b'fast...it's aimed at the business traveller. However again the waiting/chef staff couldn't be faulted. However I could have forgiven all this if it had not been for checkout. I checked my bill on screen before my final b'fast and found that I had not been charged the agreed rate, not even the higher rate but the higher rate plus the extra none package charges. At reception was the original check -in receptionist...she claimed she didn't remember the problem when we booked in. To be fair when we got the duty manager it was sorted amicably and easily....the change was on the system as a note but the girl done what was necessary to change the accounting system. Even at this stage I might have just put it all down to things going wrong and bad luck. But we paid and were asked if we ,wanted to pay in UK pounds'. This is the sort of exchange rate' scam' you expect in a cheap Bangkok restaurant not a 5* Berlin hotel. I felt is summed up the hotel...impersonal and margin driven.

Reviews.Title: “A good deal”
Reviews.Author: Trinman80
Reviews.Content: A good deal overall. The hotel is centrally located, in a quiet neighbourhood along the canal, about a 15-minute walk from Potzdamer Platz and 20 minutes from the Brandenburg Gate. Rooms are spacious, very clean and modern. Only complaint is the staff were a bit cold -- the service was not up to par for a hotel of this class. Recommended for the value.

Reviews.Title: “Über-Wellness”
Reviews.Author: TheStig67
Reviews.Content: During Easter 2008, my wife and I spent a week in Berlin at the Esplanade. It was an excellent experience. In particular, the wellness department was perfect. A nice pool and three different saunas. Adding a fitness room and the possibility to have different massage treatments (extra charge) gives you the basis for a very relaxing experience. We visited the saunas at least once a day. In addition, the restaurants are quite good and the room was very, very nice. Overall, the hotel is rather stylish kept in simple and elegant lines and colours. Taking the room rates into account, the stay was an excellent deal and experience.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Quality at 4 star prices”
Reviews.Author: WexfordKeino
Reviews.Content: Fantastic value for money, Great rooms, great facilities and the staff were very helpful. The only thing was the drinks/cocktails were a bit pricey &1l bottle of water 10 euro, but dont let that put you off, just have one nightcap!. (watch out for naked germans in the mixed sauna)

Reviews.Title: “First class”
Reviews.Author: JamesRadish
Reviews.Content: This is a modern hotel in a good location. My double room was huge and furnished to a very high standard. The only thing missing was a kettle but they brought one when requested. Polite and helpful staff Food good for a hotel, especially breakfast, and service excellent. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: M_vd_Berg
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel from 23-24 December. An excellent stay, nice spa, good food, very friendly staff and quite affordable. Check all the websites for offers, the prices I found varied 40 EUR per night. The hotel is in a quiet zone in the centre of Berlin, 15 min. walk to Potsdammer Platz with e.g. the Neue Nationalgalerie and a 15 min. walk to the Gedächtniskirche.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LemoPutney
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at this hotel after getting great rates on alpharooms well below the hotels advertised price. The hotel was excellent and the staff spoke excellent English. The staff (and Germans in general) were very helpful in pointing out Christmas markets and attractions for us to go to. We enjoyed the breakfast which was of a very high quality. Included a selection of made to order eggs (including omelettes and scrambled) and also pancakes together with Bacon, sausages cold cuts, pastries cereal, fruit, Yogurt and a wide selection of juice, tea and coffee.
